-#define MASTER_ACTVDCHAADCDRVR_
-
-/*================== [includes] ===============================================*/
-#include <SKEAZN642.h>
-
-#include "ActvDchaTypes.h"
-#include "ActvDchaDrvrUtils.h"
-#include "ActvDchaAdcDrvr_cfg.h"
-#include "ActvDchaAdcDrvr.h"
-
-/*================== [defines] =================================================*/
-#define ADC_SC1_ADCH_MASK_INV    (0xE0U)
-#define ADC_SC4_AFDEP_MASK_INV   (0xF8UL)
-
-/*================== [type definitions] =====================================*/
-typedef enum ActvDchaAdcDrvr_TrigActvStType_
-{
-   ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_HWTRIGACTV,
-   ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_SWTRIGACTV
-} ActvDchaAdcDrvr_TrigActvStType;
-
-/*================== [global variables] ========================================*/
-static volatile uint16 ActvDchaAdcDrvrRawAdcValBuf[ACTVDCH_ADCDRVR_ACTV_CHS];
-static volatile Boolean_Type ActvDchaAdcDrvrCnvnCmplFlg = FALSE;
-static volatile ActvDchaAdcDrvr_TrigActvStType ActvDchaAdcDrvrTrigActvSt;
-
-/*================== [private Function declarations] ==========================*/
-static inline void ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FillAdcFifo(ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FifoDepthType FifoDepth, uint8 AdcChIdx);
-static inline void ActvDchaAdcDrvr_ReadResult(ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FifoDepthType FifoDepth, uint8 Idx);
-static inline void ActvDchaAdcDrvr_SetFifoDepth(volatile ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FifoDepthType FifoDepth);
-
-/*================== [definition of private functions] ========================*/
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FillAdcFifo
- * \\brief   Fills the FIFO
- * \\param [in] FifoDepth : Fifo depth
- * \\param [in] AdcChIdx : ADC channel index
- * \\return : void
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-static inline void ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FillAdcFifo(ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FifoDepthType FifoDepth, uint8 AdcChIdx)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint8 i = 0U;
-   register uint32 temp = 0UL;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   temp = ADC_SC1_ADCH_MASK_INV & ADC_SC1;   /* Get state of non ADCH parts of register */
-
-   for (i = AdcChIdx; i < (AdcChIdx + (uint8)FifoDepth + (uint8) 1U); i++)        /* 1 is added because of Fifo Depth */
-   {
-      /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-      /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-      /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-       * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-      ADC_SC1 = (temp | ADC_SC1_ADCH(ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.AdcChs[i]));
-   }
-   return;
-}
-
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcDrvr_ReadResult
- * \\brief   Reads the result of ADC channels according to FIFO length
- * \\param [in] FifoDepth : Fifo depth
- * \\param [in] Idx : ADC channel index
- * \\return : void
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-static inline void ActvDchaAdcDrvr_ReadResult(ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FifoDepthType FifoDepth, uint8 Idx)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint8 i = 0x0U;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-
-   for(i = Idx; i < (Idx + (uint8)FifoDepth + (uint8) 1U); i++)                    /* 1 is added because of Fifo Depth */
-   {
-      /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-      /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-      /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-       * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-      ActvDchaAdcDrvrRawAdcValBuf[i] = (uint16) ADC_R;
-   }
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcDrvr_SetFifoDepth
- * \\brief   Sets the Fifo Depth
- * \\param [in] FifoDepth : Fifo depth to be set
- * \\return : void
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-static inline void ActvDchaAdcDrvr_SetFifoDepth(volatile ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FifoDepthType FifoDepth)
-{
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   ADC_SC4 = (ADC_SC4_AFDEP_MASK_INV & ADC_SC4) | ADC_SC4_AFDEP((uint8)FifoDepth);
-   return;
-}
-
-
-/*================== [global function definitions] ===========================*/
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcDrvr_Init(void)
- * \\brief   ADC Driver Initialisation
- * \\param [in] - Nil
- * \\return Std_Return_Type : Returns E_OK if ADC driver initialization is success, else E_NOT_OK
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-Std_Return_Type ActvDchaAdcDrvr_Init(void)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint8 i = 0U;
-   volatile uint32 pinCtrlReg = 0UL;
-   Std_Return_Type retVal = E_NOT_OK;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-
-   if ((ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.FifoDepth >= ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_FIFO_MAX_VAL)
-            || (ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_FIFO_DI == ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.FifoDepth)
-            || (ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.NrAdcChs > ACTVDCH_ADCDRVR_MAX_ACTV_CHS))
-   {
-      retVal = E_NOT_OK;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-      /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-      /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-       * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-      SIM_BASE_PTR->SCGC |= SIM_SCGC_ADC_MASK;                       /* Enable bus clock to ADC module */
-      /* Enable analog pins */
-      for (i = 0U; i < ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.NrAdcChs; i++)
-      {
-         pinCtrlReg |= (1UL << ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.AdcChs[i]);
-      }
-      /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-      /* PRQA S 0306 14 */
-      /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-       * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-      ADC_APCTL1 |= ADC_APCTL1_ADPC(pinCtrlReg);
-
-      ADC_SC3 |= ADC_SC3_ADICLK(ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.InpClkSel);        /* Bus clock selected */
-      ADC_SC3 |= ADC_SC3_ADIV(ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.ClkDivSel);          /* Clock Divider select */
-      ADC_SC3 |= ADC_SC3_MODE(ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.CnvnModSel);         /* Conversion Mode Select */
-      ADC_SC4 |= ADC_SC4_AFDEP(ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.FifoDepth);         /* Set FIFO Depth */
-      ADC_SC2 |= ADC_SC2_ADTRG_MASK;                                 /* Enable hardware trigger */
-      ADC_SC2 |= ADC_SC2_REFSEL(ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.RefSel);           /* Select voltage reference */
-      ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FillAdcFifo(ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_FIFO_8LVL, 0U);   /* Initialize FIFO to 8 for HW Trigger starting from index 0 */
-      ADC_SC1 |= ADC_SC1_ADCO_MASK;                                  /* Enable continuous conversion */
-      ADC_SC1 |= ADC_SC1_AIEN_MASK;                                  /* Interrupt Enabled */
-      ActvDchaAdcDrvrTrigActvSt = ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_HWTRIGACTV;       /* Set Default state to HW Trigger Active */
-      ActvDchaAdcDrvrCnvnCmplFlg = FALSE;
-      NvicEnIrq(ADC0_IRQn, 1UL);                                     /* Enable ADC0_IRQn vector in NVIC module */
-
-      retVal = E_OK;
-   }
-   return retVal;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcDrvr_ReadAdcValues
- * \\brief   This function with will get the Raw ADC Values
- * \\param   adcValBuffer : Pointer to buffer to copy ADC values.
- * \\param   bufLen : Length of adcValBuffer
- * \\return Std_Return_Type : Returns E_OK on success, else E_NOT_OK
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-Std_Return_Type ActvDchaAdcDrvr_ReadAdcVals(uint16 adcValBuf[], uint8 bufLen)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint8 i = 0U;
-   Std_Return_Type retVal = E_NOT_OK;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   if((TRUE == ActvDchaAdcDrvrCnvnCmplFlg) && (bufLen <= ActDchaAdcDrvrCfg.NrAdcChs))
-   {
-      for (i = 0U; i < bufLen; i++)
-      {
-         adcValBuf[i] = ActvDchaAdcDrvrRawAdcValBuf[i];
-      }
-      ActvDchaAdcDrvrCnvnCmplFlg = FALSE;
-      retVal = E_OK;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      retVal = E_NOT_OK;
-   }
-   return retVal;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ADC0_IRQHandler
- * \\brief   ADC Interrupt service routine
- * \\param [in] - Nil
- * \\return : void
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-/*! \\misra Warning No C2004:8.8 "An external object or function shall be declared in one and only one file." */
-/* PRQA S 3408 1 *//* Function is IRQ handler so it does not need an previous declaration */
-void ADC0_IRQHandler(void)
-{
-   switch(ActvDchaAdcDrvrTrigActvSt)
-   {
-      case ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_HWTRIGACTV:
-      {
-         /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-         /* PRQA S 0306 5 */
-         /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-          * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-         ADC_SC1 &= ~(uint32)ADC_SC1_ADCO_MASK;                         /* Disable continuous conversion */
-         ActvDchaAdcDrvr_ReadResult(ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_FIFO_8LVL, 0U);    /* Store 8 ADC results from index 0 */
-         ADC_SC2 &= ~(uint32)ADC_SC2_ADTRG_MASK;                        /* Enable software trigger */
-         ActvDchaAdcDrvr_SetFifoDepth(ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_FIFO_3LVL);      /* Set Fifo Depth to 3 Level */
-         ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FillAdcFifo(ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_FIFO_3LVL, 8U);   /* Fill Fifo to 3 starting from index 8 */
-         ActvDchaAdcDrvrTrigActvSt = ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_SWTRIGACTV;       /* Set State to SW Trigger */
-         break;
-      }
-      case ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_SWTRIGACTV:
-      {
-         /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-         /* PRQA S 0306 7 */
-         /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-          * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-         ActvDchaAdcDrvr_ReadResult(ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_FIFO_3LVL, 8U);    /* Store next 3 ADC results from index 8 */
-         ADC_SC2 |= ADC_SC2_ADTRG_MASK;                                 /* Enable hardware trigger */
-         ADC_SC1 |= ADC_SC1_ADCO_MASK;                                  /* Enable continuous conversion */
-         ActvDchaAdcDrvr_SetFifoDepth(ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_FIFO_8LVL);      /* Set Fifo Depth to 8 Level */
-         ActvDchaAdcDrvr_FillAdcFifo(ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_FIFO_8LVL, 0U);   /* Fill Fifo to 8 starting from index 0 */
-         ActvDchaAdcDrvrTrigActvSt = ACTVDCHA_ADCDRVR_HWTRIGACTV;       /* Set State to HW Trigger */
-         ActvDchaAdcDrvrCnvnCmplFlg = TRUE;
-         break;
-      }
-      default:
-      {
-         break;
-         /* Do nothing */
-      }
-   }
-   return;
-}

-   0x0U,                         /**< InpClkSel   : Bus Clock */

-   ACTVDCH_ADCDRVR_ACTV_CHS,     /**< PinCtrl     : Pins AD0 AD1 AD2 AD3 AD4 AD5 AD6 AD7 AD8 AD9 AD10 AD11 */

-   , ACTDCHA_ADCDRVR_INP_CH_BNDGP   = 0x17 /*!< Input channel Band Gap */

-/*================== [defines] =================================================*/
-
-/*================== [global variables] ========================================*/
-static uint32 ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvUGain_mVperStep;
-static int32 ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvUOffs_step;
-static uint32 ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvIGain_mAperStep;
-static int32 ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvIOffs_step;
-static uint32 ActvDchaAdcHndlrPhyUdcVal = 0UL;
-static uint32 ActvDchaAdcHndlrPhyIdcVal = 0UL;
-
-/*================== [private Function declarations] ==========================*/
-
-/*================== [definition of private functions] ========================*/
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcHndlr_ScaHvIFromRawAdcVal(uint16 AdcRawIdcVal)
- * \\brief   This function converts Raw ADC current value to Physical current value
- * \\param [in] uint16 AdcRawIdcVal
- * \\return  - uint32 phyValHvI - physical current value
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-static inline uint32 ActvDchaAdcHndlr_ScaHvIFromRawAdcVal(uint16 adcRawIVal_step)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint64 phyValHvI = 0ULL;
-   int64 phyValHvITemp = 0LL;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   /* Add raw value with offset */
-   phyValHvITemp = (int64)(((int64)adcRawIVal_step) + ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvIOffs_step);
-
-   if(phyValHvITemp <= 0L)
-   {
-      phyValHvI = 0ULL;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      phyValHvI = (uint64)(((uint64) phyValHvITemp) * ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvIGain_mAperStep);
-      if(UINT32_MAX_VAL < phyValHvI)
-      {
-    \t  phyValHvI =  (uint64)UINT32_MAX_VAL;
-      }
-      else
-      {
-    \t  /*Do Nothing*/
-      }
-   }
-
-   return (uint32)phyValHvI;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcHndlr_ScaHvUFromRawAdcVal(uint16 AdcRawIdcVal)
- * \\brief   This function converts Raw ADC voltage value to Physical voltage value
- * \\param [in] uint16 AdcRawIdcVal
- * \\return  uint32 phyValHvU - physical value of HV voltage
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-static inline uint32 ActvDchaAdcHndlr_ScaHvUFromRawAdcVal(uint16 adcRawUVal_step)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-
-   uint64 phyValHvU = 0ULL;
-   int64 phyValHvUTemp = 0LL;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-
-   phyValHvUTemp = (int64)(((int64)adcRawUVal_step) + ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvUOffs_step);
-
-   if(phyValHvUTemp <= 0L)
-   {
-      phyValHvU = 0ULL;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      phyValHvU = (uint64)(((uint64)phyValHvUTemp) * ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvUGain_mVperStep);
-      if(UINT32_MAX_VAL < phyValHvU)
-      {
-    \t  phyValHvU = (uint64)UINT32_MAX_VAL;
-      }
-      else
-      {
-    \t  /*Do Nothing*/
-      }
-   }
-
-   return (uint32)phyValHvU;
-}
-
-/*================== [global function definitions] ===========================*/
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcHndlr_Init
- * \\brief   This function does the ADC Handler Initialization
- * \\param [in] - Nil
- * \\return  - E_OK if adc driver installation is successful, else E_NOT_OK
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-Std_Return_Type ActvDchaAdcHndlr_Init(void)
-{
-   ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvUGain_mVperStep = ActvDchaAdcHndlrCfg.hvVoltageGain_mVperStep;
-   ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvUOffs_step = ActvDchaAdcHndlrCfg.hvVoltageOffset_step;
-   ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvIGain_mAperStep = ActvDchaAdcHndlrCfg.hvCurrentGain_mAperStep;
-   ActvDchaAdcHndlrHvIOffs_step = ActvDchaAdcHndlrCfg.hvCurrentOffset_step;
-
-   return ActvDchaAdcDrvr_Init();
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcHndlr_MainFunction
- * \\brief   Main function of ADC Handler is called in main cyclically to forward
- *          the calculated HV current and voltage values to ActvDchaHndlr and to
- *          forward the ADC values to ActvDchaSpiHndlr
- * \\param [in] - Nil
- * \\return  - void
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaAdcHndlr_MainFunction(void)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   ActvDchaAdcHndlr_DatBufType readBuffer;
-   /* Read buffer as 16 bit array with the size of the target struct */
-   uint16 readBufferArray[11u];
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-
-   if (E_OK == ActvDchaAdcDrvr_ReadAdcVals(readBufferArray, sizeof(readBufferArray)/2u))
-   {
-
-      /*! Copy the read values to the corresponding elements in the target struct */
-      readBuffer.HvCurrentVal = readBufferArray[0];
-      readBuffer.HvVoltVal      = readBufferArray[1];
-      readBuffer.CurrentVal_2 = readBufferArray[2];
-      readBuffer.HvMonMeas    = readBufferArray[3];
-      readBuffer.IgbtTempU    = readBufferArray[4];
-      readBuffer.IgbtTempV    = readBufferArray[5];
-      readBuffer.IgbtTempW    = readBufferArray[6];
-      readBuffer.P15DrvVal    = readBufferArray[7];
-      readBuffer.P2V5UcHv     = readBufferArray[8];
-      readBuffer.PcbVariant   = readBufferArray[9];
-      readBuffer.PcbVersion   = readBufferArray[10];
-
-      /*! Calculate physical current Value from Raw ADC Value */
-      ActvDchaAdcHndlrPhyIdcVal = ActvDchaAdcHndlr_ScaHvIFromRawAdcVal(readBuffer.HvCurrentVal);
-      /*! Calculate physical voltage Value from Raw ADC Value */
-      ActvDchaAdcHndlrPhyUdcVal = ActvDchaAdcHndlr_ScaHvUFromRawAdcVal(readBuffer.HvVoltVal);
-
-      /*! Forward the calculated physical voltage and current values to Active Discharge Handler */
-      ActvDchaHndlr_UpdAdcPrms(ActvDchaAdcHndlrPhyUdcVal, ActvDchaAdcHndlrPhyIdcVal);
-      /*! Forward the ADC Raw Values to SPI Handler for sending to AURIX via SPI Transport Protocol and SPI Driver */
-      ActvDchaSpiHndlr_UpdAdcPrms(&readBuffer);
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /* Do nothing */
-   }
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaAdcHndlr_UpdHvIGain
- * \\brief   This function will update the new HV Current Gain received from Aurix
- * \\param [in] - uint32 newHvIGain - New value of HV current(discharge current) gain.
- * \\return  - void
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaAdcHndlr_UpdHvIGain(uint32 newHvIGain)
-{

-Std_Return_Type ActvDchaCrc_Init(void)
-{
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:1.1  "Language extensions" */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 18 *//* PRQA S 0662 18 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   SIM->SCGC |= ((uint32)1U << SIM_SCGC_CRC_SHIFT);   /* Enable clock gating to CRC module */
-
-   CRC0->CTRL |= CRC_CTRL_TCRC_MASK;  /* Enable 32bit CRC */
-
-   CRC0->GPOLY = ActvDchaCrcCfg.Polynom;
-
-   CRC0->CTRL |= CRC_CTRL_TOT(ActvDchaCrcCfg.TransposeWr);
-   CRC0->CTRL |= CRC_CTRL_TOTR(ActvDchaCrcCfg.TransposeRead);
-
-   if(ActvDchaCrcCfg.ResCplEn == TRUE)
-   {
-      CRC0->CTRL |= (uint32)CRC_CTRL_FXOR_MASK;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      CRC0->CTRL &= ~((uint32)CRC_CTRL_FXOR_MASK);
-   }
-
-   return E_OK;
-}
-
-uint32 ActvDchaCrc_CalcCrc32(const uint8 data[], uint32 len)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint32 dataIdx = 0UL;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:1.1  "Language extensions" */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 15 *//* PRQA S 0662 15 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   CRC0->CTRL |= CRC_CTRL_WAS_MASK;
-   CRC0->DATA =  ActvDchaCrcCfg.CrcInitVal;  /* Set seed value */
-   CRC0->CTRL &= ~CRC_CTRL_WAS_MASK;
-
-   for(dataIdx = 0UL; dataIdx < len ; dataIdx++)
-   {
-      CRC0->ACCESS8BIT.DATALL = data[dataIdx];
-   }
-   /* Wait for crc to finish */
-   __NOP();
-   __NOP();
-
-   return CRC0->DATA;
-}
-
-/*================== [closure] ==============================================*/

-/*************************************************************************** */
-/*!
- * \\fn         ActvDchaUtils_LowPassFil(int32 inpVal, int32 filVal, const int32 fac, Boolean_Type firstRun)
- * \\brief      This function implements low pass filter first degree
- * \\param [in] inpVal   - Input value
- * \\param [in] filVal   - Filtered value
- * \\param [in] fac      - Filter factor
- * \\param [in] firstRun - First time execution or not
- * \\return              - Filtered value
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-int32 ActvDchaUtils_LowPassFil(int32 inpVal, int32 filVal, const uint32 fac, Boolean_Type firstRun)
-{
-   /* fac         = for Low PassFilter = dt / (RC + dt);
-    * where
-    * RC or Tau   = 1.0 / (CUTOFF * 2 * 3.14159265);
-    * dt          = 1.0 / SAMPLE_RATE;           */
-
-   int32 retVal;
-
-   if(firstRun == TRUE)
-   {
-      /* Return first measured result, prevent filter from slowly reaching measured value */
-      retVal = inpVal;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /* Division by thousand is for converting the factor from internal value to physical value. */
-      retVal = (int32)(filVal + (int32)((((int64)fac) * ((int64)inpVal - filVal))/1000));
-   }
-
-   if(retVal < 0)
-   {
-      retVal = 0;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /* Do nothing */
-   }
-
-   return retVal;
-}
-

-/* ********************************************************************** */
-/* Sourcefile: aes.c                                                      */
-/*                                                                        */
-/* Project: VW Bootloader                                                 */
-/* Active Discharge Controller                                            */
-/*                                                                        */
-/* Department: Valeo Siemens eAutomotive GmbH                             */

-
-
-/*
-
-This is an implementation of the AES algorithm, specifically ECB, CTR and CBC mode.
-Block size can be chosen in aes.h - available choices are AES128, AES192, AES256.
-
-The implementation is verified against the test vectors in:
-  National Institute of Standards and Technology Special Publication 800-38A 2001 ED
-
-ECB-AES128
-----------
-
-  plain-text:
-    6bc1bee22e409f96e93d7e117393172a
-    ae2d8a571e03ac9c9eb76fac45af8e51
-    30c81c46a35ce411e5fbc1191a0a52ef
-    f69f2445df4f9b17ad2b417be66c3710
-
-  key:
-    2b7e151628aed2a6abf7158809cf4f3c
-
-  resulting cipher
-    3ad77bb40d7a3660a89ecaf32466ef97
-    f5d3d58503b9699de785895a96fdbaaf
-    43b1cd7f598ece23881b00e3ed030688
-    7b0c785e27e8ad3f8223207104725dd4
-
-
-NOTE:   String length must be evenly divisible by 16byte (str_len % 16 == 0)
-        You should pad the end of the string with zeros if this is not the case.
-        For AES192/256 the key size is proportionally larger.
-
-*/
-
-#define AES_
-
-#ifdef UNITTESTING
-#define __attribute__(UNUSED)
-#endif
-
-/*****************************************************************************/
-/* Includes:                                                                 */
-/*****************************************************************************/
-#include <stdint.h>
-#include "aes.h"
-#include "ActvDchaTypes.h"
-#include "ActvDchaAdcHndlr.h"
-#include "ActvDchaSpiHndlr.h"
-/*****************************************************************************/
-/* Defines:                                                                  */
-/*****************************************************************************/
-/* The number of columns comprising a state in AES. This is a constant in AES. Value=4 */
-#define Nb (4U)
-
-#define Nk (4U)       /* The number of 32 bit words in a key.*/
-#define Nr (10U)      /* The number of rounds in AES Cipher. */
-#if (Nr != 10)
-#error "Nr should be 10!!, otherwise decryption will not work!"
-#endif
-
-/* jcallan@github points out that declaring Multiply as a function
- * reduces code size considerably with the Keil ARM compiler.
- * See this link for more information: https://github.com/kokke/tiny-AES-C/pull/3
- */
-#ifndef MULTIPLY_AS_A_FUNCTION
-  #define MULTIPLY_AS_A_FUNCTION 0
-#endif
-#define EEPROM_AES_KEY_ADDR (0x10000000)
-

-/* The round constant word array, Rcon[i], contains the values given by
- * x to the power (i-1) being powers of x (x is denoted as {02}) in the field GF(2^8)
- */
-static const uint8_t Rcon[11] = {
-  0x8du, 0x01u, 0x02u, 0x04u, 0x08u, 0x10u, 0x20u, 0x40u, 0x80u, 0x1bu, 0x36u };
-
-/*
- * Jordan Goulder points out in PR #12 (https://github.com/kokke/tiny-AES-C/pull/12),
- * that you can remove most of the elements in the Rcon array, because they are unused.
- *
- * From Wikipedia\'s article on the Rijndael key schedule @ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rijndael_key_schedule#Rcon
- *
- * "Only the first some of these constants are actually used - up to rcon[10] for AES-128 (as 11 round keys are needed),
- *  up to rcon[8] for AES-192, up to rcon[7] for AES-256. rcon[0] is not used in AES algorithm."
- */
-struct AES_ctx
-{
-   uint8_t RoundKey[AES_keyExpSize];
-   uint8_t Iv[AES_BLOCKLEN];
-};
-
-typedef enum AesDecryptionCmplSts_Type
-{
-   AES_DECRYPT_NOT_FINSHD = 0U
-   ,AES_DECRYPT_FINSHD
-}AesDecryptionCmplSts;
-
-typedef enum AesDecryptionState_Type
-{
-   AES_DECRYPT_STATE1 = 0U
-   ,AES_DECRYPT_STATE2
-   ,AES_DECRYPT_STATE3
-   ,AES_DECRYPT_STATE4
-}AesDecryptionState;
-
-static uint8_t AesEncryptionKey[AES_KEYLEN] = {0U};
-static int32_t ActvDchaNumOfRounds = 0;
-static struct AES_ctx AES128_context;
-static AesDecryptionState AesDecryptState = AES_DECRYPT_STATE1;
-/*****************************************************************************/
-/* Private function declarations:                                            */
-/*****************************************************************************/
-
-static uint8_t getSBoxValue(uint8_t num);
-static uint8_t getSBoxInvert(uint8_t num);
-static void KeyExpansion(uint8_t* RoundKey, const uint8_t* Key);
-static void AddRoundKey(uint8_t nofRound,state_t* state, const uint8_t* RoundKey);
-static uint8_t xtime(uint8_t x);
-#if (defined(MULTIPLY_AS_A_FUNCTION) && (MULTIPLY_AS_A_FUNCTION == 1))
-static uint8_t Multiply(uint8_t x, uint8_t y);
-#endif
-static void InvMixColumns(state_t* state);
-static void InvSubBytes(state_t* state);
-static void InvShiftRows(state_t* state);
-static inline void AES_GetEncryptionKey(void);
-/* -buffer size MUST be multiple of AES_BLOCKLEN;
- -Suggest https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Padding_(cryptography)#PKCS7 for padding scheme
- -NOTES: you need to set IV in ctx via AES_init_ctx_iv() or AES_ctx_set_iv()
- -no IV should ever be reused with the same key */
-static inline AesDecryptionCmplSts AES_CBC_decrypt_buffer_16Byte(struct AES_ctx* ctx, uint8_t* buf);
-

-/****Global variable definition ***/
-uint8_t AesDecryptMsg[AES_BLOCKLEN] = {0U};
-
-/*****************************************************************************/
-/* Private functions:                                                        */
-/*****************************************************************************/
-
-static uint8_t getSBoxValue(uint8_t num)
-{
-    return sbox[num];
-}
-
-static uint8_t getSBoxInvert(uint8_t num)
-{
-    return rsbox[num];
-}
-
-/* This function produces Nb(Nr+1) round keys. The round keys are used in each round to decrypt the states.*/
-static void KeyExpansion(uint8_t* RoundKey, const uint8_t* Key)
-{
-  /* for maintainability, the array operations on the passed RoundKey pointer used in to original implementation have been kept */
-  /* PRQA S 492 ++ */
-    uint8_t i, j, k;
-    uint8_t tempa[4]; /* Used for the column/row operations */
-
-    /* The first round key is the key itself.*/
-    for (i = 0U; i < Nk; ++i)
-    {
-        RoundKey[(i * 4U) + 0U] = Key[(i * 4U) + 0U];
-        RoundKey[(i * 4U) + 1U] = Key[(i * 4U) + 1U];
-        RoundKey[(i * 4U) + 2U] = Key[(i * 4U) + 2U];
-        RoundKey[(i * 4U) + 3U] = Key[(i * 4U) + 3U];
-    }
-
-    /* All other round keys are found from the previous round keys.*/
-    for (i = Nk; i < (Nb * (Nr + 1U)); ++i)
-    {
-        {
-            k = (i - 1U) * 4U;
-            tempa[0]=RoundKey[k + 0U];
-            tempa[1]=RoundKey[k + 1U];
-            tempa[2]=RoundKey[k + 2U];
-            tempa[3]=RoundKey[k + 3U];
-        }
-
-        if ((i % Nk) == 0U)
-        {
-            /* This function shifts the 4 bytes in a word to the left once.
-            * [a0,a1,a2,a3] becomes [a1,a2,a3,a0]
-            */
-            {
-                const uint8_t u8tmp = tempa[0];
-                tempa[0] = tempa[1];
-                tempa[1] = tempa[2];
-                tempa[2] = tempa[3];
-                tempa[3] = u8tmp;
-            }
-
-            /* SubWord() is a function that takes a four-byte input word and
-            * applies the S-box to each of the four bytes to produce an output word.
-            */
-            {
-                tempa[0] = getSBoxValue(tempa[0]);
-                tempa[1] = getSBoxValue(tempa[1]);
-                tempa[2] = getSBoxValue(tempa[2]);
-                tempa[3] = getSBoxValue(tempa[3]);
-            }
-
-            tempa[0] = tempa[0] ^ Rcon[i/Nk];
-        }
-        j = i * 4U; k=(i - Nk) * 4U;
-        RoundKey[j + 0U] = RoundKey[k + 0U] ^ tempa[0];
-        RoundKey[j + 1U] = RoundKey[k + 1U] ^ tempa[1];
-        RoundKey[j + 2U] = RoundKey[k + 2U] ^ tempa[2];
-        RoundKey[j + 3U] = RoundKey[k + 3U] ^ tempa[3];
-    }
-  /* PRQA S 492 -- */
-}
-
-/* This function adds the round key to state.
- * The round key is added to the state by an XOR function.
- */
-static void AddRoundKey(uint8_t nofRound, state_t* state, const uint8_t* RoundKey)
-{
-    /* for maintainability, the array operations on the passed RoundKey pointer used in to original implementation have been kept */
-    /* PRQA S 492 ++ */
-    uint8_t i,j;
-    for (i = 0U; i < 4U; ++i)
-    {
-        for (j = 0U; j < 4U; ++j)
-        {
-            (*state)[i][j] ^= RoundKey[(nofRound * Nb * 4U) + (i * Nb) + j];
-        }
-    }
-  /* PRQA S 492 -- */
-}
-
-static uint8_t xtime(uint8_t x)
-{
-    return (uint8_t)(((uint8_t)(x<<1)) ^ ((((uint8_t)(x>>7)) & 1U) * 0x1bu));
-}
-
-/* Multiply is used to multiply numbers in the field GF(2^8)
- * Note: The last call to xtime() is unneeded, but often ends up generating a smaller binary
- * The compiler seems to be able to vectorize the operation better this way.
- * See https://github.com/kokke/tiny-AES-c/pull/34
- */
-#if (defined(MULTIPLY_AS_A_FUNCTION) && (MULTIPLY_AS_A_FUNCTION == 1))
-static uint8_t Multiply(uint8_t x, uint8_t y)
-{
-  return (((y & 1) * x) ^
-     (((y>>1) & 1) * xtime(x)) ^
-     (((y>>2) & 1) * xtime(xtime(x))) ^
-     (((y>>3) & 1) * xtime(xtime(xtime(x)))) ^
-     (((y>>4) & 1) * xtime(xtime(xtime(xtime(x)))))); /* this last call to xtime() can be omitted */
-  }
-#else
-/* the option to use a preprocessor macro is a feature, see comment about code size with Keil compiler above */
-/* PRQA S 3453 ++ */
-#define Multiply(x, y)                                \\
-    (((((((y)   & 1U) * (x)) ^                          \\
-    ((((y)>>1) & 1U) * xtime(x))) ^                    \\
-    ((((y)>>2) & 1U) * xtime(xtime(x)))) ^             \\
-    ((((y)>>3) & 1U) * xtime(xtime(xtime(x))))) ^      \\
-    ((((y)>>4) & 1U) * xtime(xtime(xtime(xtime(x))))))
-/* PRQA S 3453 -- */
-#endif
-
-/* MixColumns function mixes the columns of the state matrix.
- * The method used to multiply may be difficult to understand for the inexperienced.
- * Please use the references to gain more information.
- */
-static void InvMixColumns(state_t* state)
-{
-    uint8_t a, b, c, d, i;
-    for (i = 0U; i < 4U; ++i)
-    {
-        a = (*state)[i][0];
-        b = (*state)[i][1];
-        c = (*state)[i][2];
-        d = (*state)[i][3];
-
-        (*state)[i][0] = ((Multiply(a, 0x0eu) ^ Multiply(b, 0x0bu)) ^ Multiply(c, 0x0du)) ^ Multiply(d, 0x09u);
-        (*state)[i][1] = ((Multiply(a, 0x09u) ^ Multiply(b, 0x0eu)) ^ Multiply(c, 0x0bu)) ^ Multiply(d, 0x0du);
-        (*state)[i][2] = ((Multiply(a, 0x0du) ^ Multiply(b, 0x09u)) ^ Multiply(c, 0x0eu)) ^ Multiply(d, 0x0bu);
-        (*state)[i][3] = ((Multiply(a, 0x0bu) ^ Multiply(b, 0x0du)) ^ Multiply(c, 0x09u)) ^ Multiply(d, 0x0eu);
-    }
-}
-
-
-/* The SubBytes Function Substitutes the values in the
- * state matrix with values in an S-box. */
-static void InvSubBytes(state_t* state)
-{
-    uint8_t i, j;
-    for (i = 0U; i < 4U; ++i)
-    {
-        for (j = 0U; j < 4U; ++j)
-        {
-            (*state)[j][i] = getSBoxInvert((*state)[j][i]);
-        }
-    }
-}
-
-static void InvShiftRows(state_t* state)
-{
-    uint8_t temp;
-
-    /* Rotate first row 1 columns to right */
-    temp = (*state)[3][1];
-    (*state)[3][1] = (*state)[2][1];
-    (*state)[2][1] = (*state)[1][1];
-    (*state)[1][1] = (*state)[0][1];
-    (*state)[0][1] = temp;
-
-    /* Rotate second row 2 columns to right */
-    temp = (*state)[0][2];
-    (*state)[0][2] = (*state)[2][2];
-    (*state)[2][2] = temp;
-
-    temp = (*state)[1][2];
-    (*state)[1][2] = (*state)[3][2];
-    (*state)[3][2] = temp;
-
-    /* Rotate third row 3 columns to right */
-    temp = (*state)[0][3];
-    (*state)[0][3] = (*state)[1][3];
-    (*state)[1][3] = (*state)[2][3];
-    (*state)[2][3] = (*state)[3][3];
-    (*state)[3][3] = temp;
-}
-
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      AES_CBC_decrypt_buffer_16Byte
- * \\brief   This function will perform the decryption operation
- * \\param [] - struct AES_ctx* ctx - AES context
- *           - uint8_t* buf - Data buffer to be decrypted
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-static inline AesDecryptionCmplSts AES_CBC_decrypt_buffer_16Byte(struct AES_ctx* ctx, uint8_t* buf)
-{
-    AesDecryptionCmplSts DecryptionCmplSts = AES_DECRYPT_NOT_FINSHD;
-    uint32_t i = 0U;
-
-    switch(AesDecryptState)
-    {
-        case AES_DECRYPT_STATE1:
-            KeyExpansion(ctx->RoundKey, AesEncryptionKey);
-            AesDecryptState = AES_DECRYPT_STATE2;
-            break;
-
-        case AES_DECRYPT_STATE2:
-            /* Copy init vector */
-            ctx->Iv[0]  = 0xd6U;
-            ctx->Iv[1]  = 0x78U;
-            ctx->Iv[2]  = 0xcbU;
-            ctx->Iv[3]  = 0xc2U;
-            ctx->Iv[4]  = 0xbfU;
-            ctx->Iv[5]  = 0x4dU;
-            ctx->Iv[6]  = 0xdeU;
-            ctx->Iv[7]  = 0x6aU;
-            ctx->Iv[8]  = 0xfcU;
-            ctx->Iv[9]  = 0x11U;
-            ctx->Iv[10] = 0x0bU;
-            ctx->Iv[11] = 0xdaU;
-            ctx->Iv[12] = 0xb6U;
-            ctx->Iv[13] = 0xd7U;
-            ctx->Iv[14] = 0x56U;
-            ctx->Iv[15] = 0xd6U;
-            /* Initialize the number of rounds */
-            ActvDchaNumOfRounds = (int32_t)Nr;
-            AddRoundKey(Nr, (state_t*)buf, ctx->RoundKey); /* PRQA S 0310 ++ */
-            AesDecryptState = AES_DECRYPT_STATE3;
-            ActvDchaNumOfRounds--;
-            break;
-
-        case AES_DECRYPT_STATE3:
-            InvShiftRows((state_t*)buf);/* PRQA S 0310 ++ */
-            InvSubBytes((state_t*)buf);/* PRQA S 0310 ++ */
-            AddRoundKey((uint8_t)ActvDchaNumOfRounds, (state_t*)buf, ctx->RoundKey);/* PRQA S 0310 ++ */
-            InvMixColumns((state_t*)buf);/* PRQA S 0310 ++ */
-            ActvDchaNumOfRounds--;
-            /* If all the rounds are done, go to the next state */
-            if(ActvDchaNumOfRounds <= 0)
-            {
-                AesDecryptState = AES_DECRYPT_STATE4;
-            }
-            break;
-
-        case AES_DECRYPT_STATE4:
-            /* The last round is given below.*/
-            /* The MixColumns function is not here in the last round.*/
-            InvShiftRows((state_t*)buf);/* PRQA S 0310 ++ */
-            InvSubBytes((state_t*)buf);/* PRQA S 0310 ++ */
-            AddRoundKey(0U, (state_t*)buf, ctx->RoundKey);/* PRQA S 0310 ++ */
-            for (i = 0U; i < AES_BLOCKLEN; ++i) /* The block in AES is always 128bit no matter the key size*/
-            {
-                buf[i] ^= ctx->Iv[i];/* PRQA S 0492 */
-            }
-            AesDecryptState = AES_DECRYPT_STATE1;
-            DecryptionCmplSts = AES_DECRYPT_FINSHD;
-            break;
-
-        default:
-            /* In case of error start from beginning. */
-            AesDecryptState = AES_DECRYPT_STATE1;
-            break;
-    }
-    return DecryptionCmplSts;
-}
-
-/*****************************************************************************/
-/* Public functions:                                                         */
-/*****************************************************************************/
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      AES_MainFunction
- * \\brief   This function performs the decryption of the received data.
- * \\param [] - No parameter
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void AES_MainFunction(void)
-{
-    AesDecryptionCmplSts AesDecryptionCmplFlg = AES_DECRYPT_NOT_FINSHD;
-    uint32_t i = 0U;
-
-    /* If all the four parts of the encrypted message is received, start decryption */
-    if(0x0FU == ActvDchaSpiHndlrEncrypedMsgRxdStatus)
-    {
-        /* Copy the received message to another buffer to decrypt,
-        * only if the decryption is not already started.  */
-        if(AES_DECRYPT_STATE1 == AesDecryptState)
-        {
-            for(i = 0U; i < AES_BLOCKLEN; i++)
-            {
-               AesDecryptMsg[i] = ActvDchaSpiHndlrSecuMsg[i];
-            }
-        }
-        /* Reset the decryption completed flag to 0 */
-        ActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus = (ActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus & ((uint8)AES_DECRYPTION_FINSHD_FLG_MASK));
-        /* Decrypt the message if it is completely received and stop decryption once the message is decrypted.
-        * Decrypttion will be performed on the input buffer itself. */
-        AesDecryptionCmplFlg = AES_CBC_decrypt_buffer_16Byte(&AES128_context,AesDecryptMsg);
-        /* If encryption is completed, set the bit3 in status byte.
-        * Also, clear the encrypted message received status. */
-        if(AES_DECRYPT_FINSHD == AesDecryptionCmplFlg)
-        {
-            AesDecryptionCmplFlg = AES_DECRYPT_NOT_FINSHD;
-            ActvDchaSpiHndlrEncrypedMsgRxdStatus = 0U;
-            /* Set the decrypted message validity flag. */
-            ActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus = (ActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus | (uint8)(~((uint8)AES_DECRYPTION_FINSHD_FLG_MASK)));
-        }
-        else
-        {
-            /* Do nothing */
-        }
-    }
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      AES_Init
- * \\brief   This function get the key from EEPROM and do the necessary initialization.
- * \\param [] - No parameter
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void AES_Init(void)
-{
-    uint32_t i = 0U;
-
-    /* Get the AES key from EEPROM */
-    /* Assign the pointer with address of EEPROM, where key is stored */
-    uint8_t *ptrEepromEncryptionKey = (uint8_t *)EEPROM_AES_KEY_ADDR;/* PRQA S 306 ++ */
-    /* Copy key(16 byte) from EEPROM */
-    /* PRQA S 3440 ++ */
-    for(i = 0U; i < AES_KEYLEN; i++)
-    {
-        AesEncryptionKey[i] = (uint8_t)(*(ptrEepromEncryptionKey++));/* PRQA S 489 ++ */
-    }
-    /* Initialize other variables */
-    AesDecryptState = AES_DECRYPT_STATE1;
-}

-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaRdySt(void);
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaActvSt(void);
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaCoolDownSt(void);
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaHysSt(void);
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaFltSt(void);
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaSysProtectionSt(void);
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_Diagnose(void);
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_SetPwmDutyCycle(uint32 dutyCycle_mPerc);
-
-
-/*================== [definition of local functions] ========================*/
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_InhibitFlgCond(void)
-{
-   if (FALSE == ActvDchaHndlrNewSpiPrmFlg)
-   {
-      /* Inhibit enable delay active */
-      if (ActvDchaHndlrDchaSpiPrmTimeoutTmr >= ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaSpiPrmTimeoutTmrTopVal)
-      {
-         /* Enable active discharge after delay */
-         ActvDchaHndlrActvDchaEn = TRUE;
-         /* Error counter overflow protection*/
-         if(ActvDchaHndlrSpiTimeoutErrCtr < UINT32_MAX_VAL)
-         {
-             ActvDchaHndlrSpiTimeoutErrCtr++;
-         }
-         else
-         {
-            /* Do Nothing */
-         }
-      }
-      else
-      {
-         ActvDchaHndlrDchaSpiPrmTimeoutTmr++;
-      }
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /* reset inhibit delay counter */
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaSpiPrmTimeoutTmr = 0U;
-      /* Enable/Disable active discharge according to received SPI parameter */
-      if (TRUE == ActvDchaHndlrSpiInhibitFlg)
-      {
-         ActvDchaHndlrActvDchaEn = FALSE;
-      }
-      else
-      {
-         ActvDchaHndlrActvDchaEn = TRUE;
-      }
-   }
-
-   ActvDchaHndlrNewSpiPrmFlg = FALSE;   // reset newSpiPrm flag
-}
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaMgr(void)
-{
-\tswitch (ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt)
-\t{
-\t\tcase DCHA_READY:
-\t\t\tActvDchaHndlr_DchaRdySt();
-\t\tbreak;
-
-\t\tcase DCHA_ACTIVE:
-\t\t\tActvDchaHndlr_DchaActvSt();
-\t\tbreak;
-
-\t\tcase DCHA_COOL_DOWN:
-\t\t\tActvDchaHndlr_DchaCoolDownSt();
-\t\tbreak;
-
-\t\tcase DCHA_LV_HYST:
-\t\t\tActvDchaHndlr_DchaHysSt();
-\t\tbreak;
-
-\t\tcase DCHA_FAULT:
-\t\t\tActvDchaHndlr_DchaFltSt();
-\t\tbreak;
-
-\t\tcase DCHA_SYS_PROTECTION:
-\t\t\tActvDchaHndlr_DchaSysProtectionSt();
-\t\tbreak;
-
-\t\tcase DCHA_ERROR:
-\t\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus |= (uint8)((uint8)1U << DCHAERR_STS_BIT_POS);
-\t\tbreak;
-
-\t\tdefault:
-\t\tbreak;
-\t}
-}
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_Diagnose(void)
-{
-\tint32 P15UPhyValMilliVolt = 0L;
-\t/* Clear current monitoring fault bits */
-\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus = (uint8)(ActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus & (uint8)(0xF9u));
-\t/* Convert mA to uA, else filtering will not work as expected(there will not be any changes in current unless there is a change of 1000mA) */
-\tActvDchaHndlrHvIMicroAmpr = (int32)((int32)ActvDchaHndlrHvI_mA * (int32)ACTVDCHA_MILLI_TO_MICRO_CONV_FAC);
-\tActvDchaHndlrHvIFildMicroAmpr = ActvDchaUtils_LowPassFil(ActvDchaHndlrHvIMicroAmpr,ActvDchaHndlrHvIFildMicroAmpr,ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaHvILpFilFac,ActvDchaHndlrFirstRun);
-\t/* Check for the first run */
-\tif(ActvDchaHndlrFirstRun == TRUE)
-\t{
-\t\tActvDchaHndlrFirstRun = FALSE;
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t\t/* Do nothing */
-\t}
-\tActvDchaHndlrHvIFildMilliAmpr = (uint32)ActvDchaHndlrHvIFildMicroAmpr/ACTVDCHA_MILLI_TO_MICRO_CONV_FAC;
-\t/*Monitoring of Over Current when Active discharge is not active */
-\tif (DCHA_ACTIVE != ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt)
-\t{
-\t\tif (ActvDchaHndlrHvIFildMilliAmpr > ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaInActOvrCurrThd)
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus |= (uint8)((uint8)1U << DCHA_INACT_OVRCURR_ERR_STS_BIT_POS);
-\t\t}
-\t\telse
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus  =  (uint8)(ActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus & (uint8)(0xFDu));
-
-\t\t}
-
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t\t/*Monitoring of Over Current when Active discharge is active */
-\t\tif (ActvDchaHndlrHvIFildMilliAmpr > ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaActOvrCurrThd)
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus |= (uint8)((uint8)1U << DCHA_ACT_OVR_UNDR_CURR_ERR_STS_BIT_POS);
-
-\t\t}
-\t\t      /*Monitoring of Under Current when Active discharge is active */
-\t\telse if ((ActvDchaHndlrHvIFildMilliAmpr < ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaActUndrCurrThd)
-\t\t\t\t&& (ActvDchaHndlrHvU_mV > ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaLowUThd_mv))
-
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus |= (uint8)((uint8)1U << DCHA_ACT_OVR_UNDR_CURR_ERR_STS_BIT_POS);
-
-\t\t}
-\t\telse
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus = (uint8)(ActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus & (uint8)(0xFBu));
-\t\t}
-\t}
-\t/* Calculate the P15 power supply physical value from the ADC data. Gain is in micro volt/step. */
-\tP15UPhyValMilliVolt = ((((int32)ActvDchaSpiHndlrAdcVals.P15DrvVal + (int32)ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaP15UOffs) * (int32)ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaP15UGain)/1000L);
-\t/* Perform P15 power supply range check. If out of range, set the Bit5 of status byte. Else clear it. */
-\tif((P15UPhyValMilliVolt < (int32)ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaP15LowrThd) || (P15UPhyValMilliVolt > (int32)ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaP15UpprThd))
-\t{
-\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus |= (uint8)((1<<ACTV_DCHA_P15U_LIM_ERR_BIT_POS));
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus &= (uint8)(~((uint8)(1<<ACTV_DCHA_P15U_LIM_ERR_BIT_POS)));
-\t}
-}
-
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaRdySt(void)
-{
-   if (TRUE == ActvDchaHndlrActvDchaEn)
-   {
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt = DCHA_ACTIVE;
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaEnTmr = 0U;
-   }
-   else if (ActvDchaHndlrHvU_mV <= ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaLowUThd_mv)
-   {
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt = DCHA_COOL_DOWN;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /* Do nothing */
-   }
-}
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaActvSt(void)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint64 dutyCycle_mPerc = 0U;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   /* Over flow protection */
-   if(ActvDchaHndlrDchaEnTmr < UINT16_MAX_VAL)
-   {
-        ActvDchaHndlrDchaEnTmr++;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /*Do Nothing*/
-   }
-
-   if (ActvDchaHndlrDchaEnTmr >= ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaEnTmrTopVal)
-   {
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaEnTmr = 0U;
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt = DCHA_FAULT;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      if ((ActvDchaHndlrHvU_mV <= ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaLowUThd_mv) || (FALSE == ActvDchaHndlrActvDchaEn))
-      {
-         ActvDchaHndlrDchaEnTmr = 0U;
-         ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt = DCHA_COOL_DOWN;
-      }
-      else
-      {
-#ifdef DCHA_EN
-         dutyCycle_mPerc = (((uint64) ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaPwrMax_mW * ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaRNom_mOhm * ActvDchaHndlrPercFac1)
-                                        / ((uint64) ActvDchaHndlrHvU_mV * ActvDchaHndlrHvU_mV));
-         /* Limit the value to UINT32_MAX_VAL */
-         if(dutyCycle_mPerc > UINT32_MAX_VAL)
-         {
-            dutyCycle_mPerc = (uint64)UINT32_MAX_VAL;
-         }
-         else
-         {
-            /* Do nothing */
-         }
-#endif
-      }
-   }
-   /* Set PWM duty cycle */
-   ActvDchaHndlr_SetPwmDutyCycle((uint32)dutyCycle_mPerc);
-}
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaCoolDownSt(void)
-{
-
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaRetryCtr = 0U;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaEnTmr = 0U;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt = DCHA_LV_HYST;
-}
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaHysSt(void)
-{
-   if (ActvDchaHndlrHvU_mV > ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaHysUThd_mV)
-   {
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt = DCHA_READY;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /* Do nothing */
-   }
-}
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaFltSt(void)
-{
-   if(ActvDchaHndlrDchaRetryCtr < ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaMaxRetryCnt)
-   {
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt = DCHA_SYS_PROTECTION;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt = DCHA_ERROR;
-   }
-   /* Overflow protection */
-   if(ActvDchaHndlrDchaRetryCtr < UINT16_MAX_VAL)
-   {
-      ActvDchaHndlrDchaRetryCtr++;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /*Do Nothing*/
-   }
-}
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_DchaSysProtectionSt(void)
-{
-\tif(ActvDchaHndlrDchaSysProtectTmr < UINT16_MAX_VAL)
-\t{
-\t   ActvDchaHndlrDchaSysProtectTmr++;
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t   /*Do Nothing*/
-\t}
-
-\tif (ActvDchaHndlrDchaSysProtectTmr >= ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaSysProtectTmrTopVal)
-\t{
-\t  ActvDchaHndlrDchaSysProtectTmr = 0U;
-\t  ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt = DCHA_READY;
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t  /* Do nothing */
-\t}
-}
-
-static inline void ActvDchaHndlr_SetPwmDutyCycle(uint32 dutyCycle_mPerc)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-
-   /* Convert duty cycle in millipercentage to a value with resolution 0.01.
-\t* That is ActvDchaHndlrPwmDutyCyc = 1 means 0.01 % duty cycle.
-\t*  This variable is used as a measurement variable and is send back to Aurix */
-   ActvDchaHndlrPwmDutyCyc = (dutyCycle_mPerc/10U);
-   /* Check if the new duty cycle is 0(disable PWM) */
-   if(dutyCycle_mPerc > ACTV_DCHA_PWM_DUTY_CYC_ZERO)
-   {
-\t\t/* Update the flag to true as PWM is enabled */
-\t\tActvDchaHndlrPwmEnSts = TRUE;
-\t\t/* Set the flag to indicate that active discharge is really happening*/
-\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus |= ((uint8)ACTV_DCHA_ENAD_STS_MASK);
-   }
-   else
-   {
-\t\t/* Clear the active discharge activation status bit(bit4).
-\t\t* This bit will be set, if the PWM duty cycle is
-\t\t* grater than 0(Active discharge is really happening) */
-\t\tActvDchaSpiHndlrStatus &= ((uint8)(~ACTV_DCHA_ENAD_STS_MASK));
-\t\t/* Update the flag to false as PWM is disabled */
-\t\tActvDchaHndlrPwmEnSts = FALSE;
-   }
-   /* Set PWM duty cycle */
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvr_UpdPwmDutyCycle(dutyCycle_mPerc);
-}
-/*================== [definition of global functions] =======================*/
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
-* \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_Init
- * \\brief Initialize Active Discharge Handler
- * @param hndlrCfg pointer to configuration for ActvDchaHndlr
- * @return
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-Std_Return_Type ActvDchaHndlr_Init(void)
-{
-   /* Initialize configuration for discharge manager */
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaPwrMax_mW   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaPwrMax_mW;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaRNom_mOhm   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaR_mOhm;
-
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaLowUThd_mv  = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaLowUThd_mV;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaHysUThd_mV  = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaHystUThd_mV;
-
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaSpiPrmTimeoutTmrTopVal  = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaSpiPrmTimeoutDurMax_Msec;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaEnTmrTopVal             = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaEnDurMax_ms;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaSysProtectTmrTopVal     = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaSysProtectionDurMax_ms;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaInActOvrCurrThd         = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaInActOvrCurrThd_mA;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaActOvrCurrThd           = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaActOvrCurrThd_mA;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaActUndrCurrThd          = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaActUndrCurrThd_mA;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaMaxRetryCnt   \t\t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaMaxRetryCnt;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaAlvCntrErrSmlnEn   \t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaAlvCntrErrSmlnEn;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaCRCErrSmlnEn   \t\t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaCRCErrSmlnEn;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaBdTestEn   \t\t\t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaBdTestEn;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaDutyCycTestVal   \t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaDutyCycTestVal;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaP15UOffs   \t\t\t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaP15UOffs;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaP15UGain   \t\t\t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaP15UGain;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaP15UpprThd   \t\t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaP15UpprThd;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaP15LowrThd   \t\t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaP15LowrThd;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaHvILpFilFac   \t\t   = ActvDchaHndlrCfg.dchaHvILpFilFac;
-
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt        = DCHA_READY;
-   ActvDchaHndlrActvDchaRqTmrEn  = FALSE;
-   ActvDchaHndlrNewSpiPrmFlg     = FALSE;
-   ActvDchaHndlrSpiInhibitFlg    = FALSE;
-   ActvDchaHndlrActvDchaEn       = FALSE;
-
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaRetryCtr      = 0U;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaEnTmr         = 0U;
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaSysProtectTmr = 0U;
-
-   return ActvDchaPwmDrvr_Init();
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_MainFunction
- * \\brief Main function of ActvDchaHndlr
- * @return
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-Std_Return_Type ActvDchaHndlr_MainFunction(void)
-{
-\tuint32 dutyCycle_mPerc = 0UL;
-
-\tActvDchaHndlr_InhibitFlgCond();
-\t/* Monitor discharge current */
-\tActvDchaHndlr_Diagnose();
-\t/* Active discharge manager function */
-\tActvDchaHndlr_DchaMgr();
-\t/* If PU board testing is enabled and there is no active discharge request, set PWM duty cycle based on the request.*/
-\tif((ACTVDCHA_BD_TEST_ENABLE == ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaBdTestEn) && (FALSE == ActvDchaHndlrActvDchaEn))
-\t{
-\t\t/* Convert PWM duty cycle in % to milliPercentage */
-\t\tdutyCycle_mPerc = (ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaDutyCycTestVal * ACTVDCHA_MILLI_PERC_CONV_FAC);
-\t\t/* Set PWM duty cycle. */
-\t\tActvDchaHndlr_SetPwmDutyCycle(dutyCycle_mPerc);
-\t}
-\telse
-\t{
-\t\t/* If PWM is enabled by the board test mode, disable PWM */
-\t\tif((DCHA_ACTIVE != ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrSt) && (TRUE == ActvDchaHndlrPwmEnSts))
-\t\t{
-\t\t\tdutyCycle_mPerc = 0UL;
-\t\t\tActvDchaHndlr_SetPwmDutyCycle(dutyCycle_mPerc);
-\t\t}
-\t\telse
-\t\t{
-\t\t\t/* Do nothing */
-\t\t}
-
-\t}
-\treturn E_OK;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_UpdAdcPrms
- * \\brief Update Parameters provided by ADC Handler
- * @param voltage_mV: Voltage of HV circuit in milli-volt
- * @param current_mA: Discharge current milli-ampere
- * @return
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdAdcPrms(uint32 voltage_mV, uint32 current_mA)
-{
-   ActvDchaHndlrHvU_mV = voltage_mV;
-   ActvDchaHndlrHvI_mA = current_mA;
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_UpdSpiPrms
- * \\brief Update ActvDcha inhibit flag
- * @param inhibitFlag: Flag controlling Active Discharge
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdSpiPrms(uint8 inhibitFlg)
-{
-   if(1U == inhibitFlg)
-   {
-      ActvDchaHndlrSpiInhibitFlg = TRUE;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      ActvDchaHndlrSpiInhibitFlg = FALSE;
-   }
-   ActvDchaHndlrNewSpiPrmFlg = TRUE;    // set newSpiPrm flag
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_UpdMinVoltThds
- * \\brief Update minimum voltage threshold
- * @param newMinVoltThd_mV: Minimum voltage value
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdDchaLowUThd(uint32 newLowUThd_mV)
-{
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaLowUThd_mv = newLowUThd_mV;
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_UpdHysVoltThds
- * \\brief Update hysteresis voltage threshold
- * @param newHysVoltThd_mV: Hysteresis voltage value
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdDchaHysUThd(uint32 newHysUThd_mV)
-{
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaHysUThd_mV = newHysUThd_mV;
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_UpdMaxDchaPwr
- * \\brief Update maximum discharge power
- * @param newMaxDchaPwr_mW: Maximum discharge power value
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdDchaPwrMax(uint32 newDchaPwrMax_mW)
-{
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaPwrMax_mW = newDchaPwrMax_mW;
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_UpdHwTrigDly
- * \\brief Update Hardware Trigger delay
- * @param hwTrigDly_ns
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdHwTrigDly(uint32 hwTrigDly_ns)
-{
-#ifdef SWIT_Active
-   SWIT_ActvDchaHndlr_UpdHwTrigDly_BgnHook(&hwTrigDly_ns);
-#endif
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvr_UpdHwTrigDly(hwTrigDly_ns);
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_UpdTopVal_DchaEnTmr
- * \\brief Update top value for discharge enable timer
- * @param newTopVal_ms: new timer top value in milli seconds
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdTopVal_DchaEnTmr(uint16 newTopVal_ms)
-{
-   /* Save it as top value for discharge enable timer */
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaEnTmrTopVal = newTopVal_ms;
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_UpdTopVal_DchaSysProtectionTmr
- * \\brief Update top value for system protection timer
- * @param newTopVal_ms: new timer top value in milli seconds
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdTopVal_DchaSysProtectionTmr(uint16 newTopVal_ms)
-{
-   /*Save it as top value for system protection timer */
-   ActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaSysProtectTmrTopVal = newTopVal_ms;
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdTopVal_DchaSpiPrmTimeoutTmr(uint16 newTopVal_ms)
- * \\brief Update top value for valid SPI message timer
- * @param newTopVal_ms: new timer top value in millisecond
- */
-void ActvDchaHndlr_UpdTopVal_DchaSpiPrmTimeoutTmr(uint16 newTopVal_ms)
-{
-\tActvDchaHndlrDchaMgrCfg.dchaSpiPrmTimeoutTmrTopVal = newTopVal_ms;
-\treturn;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaHndlr_UpdDchaInActOvrCurrThd
- * \\brief Update Over current threshold when Active discharge is Inactive
- * @param InActOvrCurrThd_mA: Over current threshold value
- */
-/******************************************************************/

-   5U,      /** <dchaHvILpFilFac                : HV current lowpass filter factor internal value(1 corresponds to 0.001) */
-   35000U,  /** <dchaPwrMax_mW                  : maximum discharge power in milli Watts */
-   43000U,  /** <dchaR_mOhm                     : discharge resistance in milli ohms */
-   47000U,  /** <dchaLowUThd_mV                 : discharge shutdown voltage threshold */
-   60000U,  /** <dchaHystUThd_mV                : discharge hysteresis voltage threshold */
-   10U,     /** <dchaSpiPrmTimeoutDurMax_Msec   : spi parameter update timeout */
-   250U,    /** <dchaInActOvrCurrThd_mA         : Over current threshold when Active discharge is Inactive */
-   25000U,  /** <dchaActOvrCurrThd_mA           : Over current threshold when Active discharge is Active */
-   800U,    /** <dchaActUndrCurrThd_mA          : Under current threshold when Active discharge is Active */
-   5000U,   /** <dchaEnDurMax_ms                : maximum continuous discharge time */
-   30000U,  /** <dchaSysProtectionDurMax_ms     : system protection timeout time */

-   6771U,   /**< dchaP15UGain \t\t\t    \t: P15 power supply voltage gain in microvolt/step */
-   8000U,   /**< dchaP15LowrThd \t\t\t    : P15 power supply voltage lower threshold in mV */
-   20000U,  /**< dchaP15UpprThd \t\t\t    : P15 power supply voltage upper threshold in mV  */

-static inline void ActvDcha_ClkInit(void)
-{
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 15 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-
-   ICS_C1 |= ICS_C1_IRCLKEN_MASK; /* Enable the internal reference clock*/
-   ICS_C3 = 0x56U;    /* On demo board value might be different (0x46U) */
-
-   while ((ICS_S & ICS_S_LOCK_MASK) == 0U)
-   {
-      ; /* Wait for PLL lock, now running at 40 MHz (1024 *39.0625 kHz) */
-   }
-
-   SIM->BUSDIV = SIM_BUSDIV_BUSDIV_MASK;  /* Bus clock is ICSOUTCLK divided by 2 */
-
-   ICS_C2 &= (uint8) (~ICS_C2_BDIV_MASK);
-   ICS_C2 |= ICS_C2_BDIV(0x0U);  /*BDIV=1, ICSOUTCLK = 40 MHz*/
-}

-          /* t [us] = n_SysTick / (f_CPU [Mhz]) */

-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaPortHndlr_Init
- * \\brief   Init function for Port Handling
- * \\param [in] ActvDchaPortHndlr_PinType outputPins[], uint8 nOutputPins,
- *             ActvDchaPortHndlr_PinType inputPins[], uint8 nInputPins
- * \\return  Std_ReturnType
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-Std_Return_Type ActvDchaPortHndlr_Init(void)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint8 i           = 0U;
-   uint32 outpReg    = 0UL;
-   uint32 inpReg     = 0UL;
-   uint32 pullUpReg  = 0UL;
-
-   ActvDchaPortHndlr_PinType outpPin;
-   ActvDchaPortHndlr_PinType inpPin;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-
-   for (i = 0U; i < ACTVDCHA_PORTHNDLR_OUTP_PINS; i++)
-   {
-      outpPin = ActDchaPortHndlrOutpPinCfg[i];
-      outpPins[i] = outpPin.PinNr;
-
-      outpReg |= (1UL << outpPin.PinNr);
-
-      if (TRUE == outpPin.PullUpEn)
-      {
-         pullUpReg |= (1UL << outpPin.PinNr);
-      }
-   }
-
-   for (i = 0U; i < ACTVDCHA_PORTHNDLR_INP_PINS; i++)
-   {
-      inpPin = ActDchaPortHndlrInpPinCfg[i];
-      inpPins[i] = inpPin.PinNr;
-
-      inpReg |= (1UL << inpPin.PinNr);
-
-      if (TRUE == inpPin.PullUpEn)
-      {
-         pullUpReg |= (1UL << inpPin.PinNr);
-      }
-   }
-
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 5 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   PORT_PUEL = pullUpReg; /* Configure pull ups */
-   FGPIOA_PDDR = outpReg; /* Configure output pins as outputs */
-   FGPIOA_PIDR = ~inpReg; /* Configure input pins as inputs */
-   return E_OK;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn      ActvDchaPortHndlr_SetOutpPins
- * \\brief   Function to set output pins
- * \\param [in] uint8 outp

- */
-/******************************************************************/

-   {
-      if ((outp & (uint8)(1U << i)) > 0U)
-      {
-         reg |= (1UL << outpPins[i]);
-      }
-   }
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   FGPIOA_PDOR = reg;
-}

-/******************************************************************/

-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint8 i = 0U;
-   uint32 res = 0UL;
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   uint32 reg = FGPIOA_PDIR;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-
-   for (i = 0U; i < ACTVDCHA_PORTHNDLR_INP_PINS; i++)
-   {
-      res |= ((reg & (1UL << inpPins[i])) >> inpPins[i]) << i;
-   }
-   return (uint8) res;

-/* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-/* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
- * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-static FTM_Type*  ActvDchaPwmDrvrFtmBases[] = FTM_BASE_PTRS;
-static uint32     ActvDchaPwmDrvrFtmSimMasks[] = { SIM_SCGC_FTM0_MASK, SIM_SCGC_FTM1_MASK, SIM_SCGC_FTM2_MASK };

-/*================== [definition of local functions] ========================*/
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaPwmDrvr_NsecToCount
- * \\brief Helper function to convert a duration in nanoseconds
- *        to clock cycles
- * @param ns            Duration to convert in [ns]
- * @param clockFreqInHz Frequency of the clock in [Hz]
- * @return - Nano Second to Count coverted value stored in variable\'result\' 
- *         of type static uint32 */
-/******************************************************************/
-static uint32 ActvDchaPwmDrvr_NsecToCount(uint32 ns, uint32 clockFreq)
-{
-   uint64 result;
-
-   result = (uint64)(((uint64)((uint64)ns * clockFreq)) / 1000000000UL);
-   if(UINT32_MAX_VAL < result)
-   {
-      result = (uint64)UINT32_MAX_VAL;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      /* Do Nothing*/
-   }
-   return (uint32)result;
-}
-
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaPwmDrvr_CountToNsec
- * \\brief Helper function to convert a duration in clock cycles
- *        to nanoseconds
- * @param count         Number of clock cycles
- * @param clockFreqInHz Frequency of the clock in [Hz]
- * @return - Count to Nano Second coverted value stored in variable\'result\' 
- *          of type static uint32 */
-/******************************************************************/
-static uint32 ActvDchaPwmDrvr_CountToNsec(uint32 count, uint32 clockFreq)
-{
-   uint64 result;
-
-   if(0UL != clockFreq)
-   {
-      result = (uint64)(((uint64)((uint64)count * 1000000000UL)) / clockFreq);
-      if(UINT32_MAX_VAL < result)
-      {
-          result = (uint64)UINT32_MAX_VAL;
-      }
-      else
-      {
-          /*Do Nothing*/
-      }
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      result = 0U;
-   }
-   return (uint32)result;
-}
-
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaPwmDrvr_SetPwmActiveLevel
- * \\brief Set PWM level for initialized FTM instance
- * @param pwmLvl provides option for active level (active high, active low) or disable of PWM
- * @return Void 
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-static inline void ActvDchaPwmDrvr_SetPwmActvLvl(FtmPwmLvlType pwmLvl)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint32 reg = 0UL;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   /* Setup FTM channel */
-   /* Buffer CnSC register */
-   reg = ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->CONTROLS[ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.chNr].CnSC;
-
-   /* Clear the current PWM mode and edge level bits */
-   reg &= ~((uint32)FTM_CnSC_MSA_MASK | (uint32)FTM_CnSC_MSB_MASK | (uint32)FTM_CnSC_ELSA_MASK | (uint32)FTM_CnSC_ELSB_MASK);
-   /* Setup the active level */
-   if (FtmNoPwmSignal == pwmLvl)
-   {
-      reg &= ~((uint32)pwmLvl << FTM_CnSC_ELSA_SHIFT);
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      reg |= (uint32)pwmLvl << FTM_CnSC_ELSA_SHIFT;
-   }
-
-   /* Edge-aligned mode needs MSB to be 1, don\'t care for Center-aligned mode */
-   reg |= (uint32)1U << FTM_CnSC_MSB_SHIFT;
-
-   /* Update CnSC register */
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->CONTROLS[ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.chNr].CnSC = reg;
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaPwmDrvr_GetInstance
- * \\brief Return integer number representing FTM Module instance ID (FTM0 => ID=0 ...)
- * @param ftm: FTM instance
- * @return - Instance index from ftm address mappings of type uint32.
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-static uint32 ActvDchaPwmDrvr_GetInstance(const FTM_Type* ftm)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint32 instance      = 0UL;
-   uint32 ftmArrayCount = 0UL;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   ftmArrayCount = (sizeof(ActvDchaPwmDrvrFtmBases) / sizeof(ActvDchaPwmDrvrFtmBases[0]));
-
-   /* Find the instance index from ftm address mappings. */
-   for (instance = 0UL; instance < ftmArrayCount; instance++)
-   {
-      if (ActvDchaPwmDrvrFtmBases[instance] == ftm)
-      {
-         break;
-      }
-      else
-      {
-         /* do nothing */
-      }
-   }
-   return instance;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaPwmDrvr_EnaEPwmMod
- * \\brief Enable edge-aligned PWM mode
- * @return - Status of function Enable PWM Node of type \'Std_Return_Type\'.
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-static Std_Return_Type ActvDchaPwmDrvr_EnaEPwmMod(void)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint32 mod      = 0UL;
-   uint32 ftmClock = 0UL;
-   Std_Return_Type retVal = E_NOT_OK;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   ftmClock = (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.srcClk_Hz / ((uint32)1U << (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->SC & FTM_SC_PS_MASK)));
-
-   /* Clear Center-Aligned PWM Select flag */
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->SC &= ~(uint32)FTM_SC_CPWMS_MASK;
-   /* Set the PWM period */
-   mod = (ftmClock / ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.pwmFrq_Hz) - 1UL;
-   if (mod >= 65535U)
-   {
-      retVal = E_NOT_OK;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->MOD = mod;
-
-      ActvDchaPwmDrvr_SetPwmActvLvl(FtmPwmHighTrue);
-      retVal =  E_OK;
-   }
-   return retVal;
-}
-/*================== [definition of global functions] =======================*/
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaPwmDrvr_Init
- * \\brief Initialize FTM for PWM output
- * @param ftm pointer to FTM Instance
- * @param config pointer to PWM configuration
- * @param chNr PwmChType defining channel to output PWM
- * @return - Status of function ActvDchaPwmDrvr_Init of type \'Std_Return_Type\'
- */
-/******************************************************************/
-Std_Return_Type ActvDchaPwmDrvr_Init(void)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint32 simBaseSoptReg = 0UL;
-   uint32 ftmInstanceIdx = 0UL;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   ftmInstanceIdx = ActvDchaPwmDrvr_GetInstance(ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule);
-
-   /* Ungate the FTM clock */
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   SIM_BASE_PTR->SCGC |= ActvDchaPwmDrvrFtmSimMasks[ftmInstanceIdx];
-
-   if(FtmCh4 == ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.chNr)
-   {
-      /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-      /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-      /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-       * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-      SIM_BASE_PTR->SOPT &= ~(uint32)SIM_SOPT_NMIE_MASK;   /* Disable NMI on channel 4 */
-   }
-
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 36 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-
-   /* Enable FTM mode and disable write protection */
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->MODE = FTM_MODE_WPDIS_MASK;
-
-   /* Setup register reload point */
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->SYNC &= ~(((uint32)FTM_SYNC_CNTMAX_MASK) | ((uint32)FTM_SYNC_CNTMIN_MASK));
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->SYNC |= FTM_SYNC_CNTMAX_MASK;
-
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->SC &= ~(((uint32)FTM_SC_PS_MASK) | ((uint32)FTM_SC_CLKS_MASK));
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->SC |= FTM_SC_PS(ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.prescaler);   /* Set Prescale Factor */
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->SC |= FTM_SC_CLKS(ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.clkSrc);    /* Set Clock Source */
-
-   /* Setup the counter operation in debug mode*/
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->CONF &= ~((uint32)FTM_CONF_BDMMODE_MASK);
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->CONF |= FTM_CONF_BDMMODE(ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.bdmMode);
-
-   /* Initial state of channel output */
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->OUTINIT = ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.chInitState;
-
-   /* Channel polarity */
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->POL = ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.chPolarity;
-
-   /* Initialize hardware trigger and delay */
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->EXTTRIG |= FTM_EXTTRIG_INITTRIGEN_MASK;
-   simBaseSoptReg = SIM_BASE_PTR->SOPT;
-   simBaseSoptReg &= ~(((uint32)SIM_SOPT_ADHWT_MASK) | ((uint32)SIM_SOPT_DELAY_MASK) | ((uint32)SIM_SOPT_BUSREF_MASK));
-   /* Select FTM2 init trigger with 8-bit programmable delay as hardware trigger */
-   simBaseSoptReg |= SIM_SOPT_ADHWT(2);
-   simBaseSoptReg |= SIM_SOPT_DELAY( ActvDchaPwmDrvr_NsecToCount(ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.hwTrigDly_ns,
-                                                                         (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.srcClk_Hz /
-                                                                          ((uint32)1U << (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.prescaler)))));
-   simBaseSoptReg |= SIM_SOPT_BUSREF(ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.hwTrigDlyPrescaler);
-   SIM_BASE_PTR->SOPT = simBaseSoptReg;
-
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPercFac = 100000UL;
-
-   return ActvDchaPwmDrvr_EnaEPwmMod();
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaPwmDrvr_UpdPwmDutyCycle
- * \\brief Update PWM duty cycle (0.0 - 100.0%)
- * @param dutyCycle_mPerc unsigned integer representing duty cycle in percent (100000 = 100.0%)
- * @return - void*/
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaPwmDrvr_UpdPwmDutyCycle(uint32 dutyCycle_mPerc)
-{
-   /* ******** Variables declaration *********** */
-   uint32 mod = ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->MOD;
-   uint32 cnv = 0UL;
-
-   /* ************* Source code **************** */
-   /* Condition dutyCyclePerc */
-   dutyCycle_mPerc = (dutyCycle_mPerc > ActvDchaPwmDrvrPercFac) ? ActvDchaPwmDrvrPercFac : dutyCycle_mPerc;
-
-   if (0UL == dutyCycle_mPerc)
-   {
-      /* Signal stays low */
-      cnv = 0UL;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      cnv = (uint32) (((uint64) mod * dutyCycle_mPerc) / ActvDchaPwmDrvrPercFac);
-      /* For 100% duty cycle */
-      if (cnv >= mod)
-      {
-         cnv = mod + 1UL;
-      }
-      else
-      {
-         /* Do nothing */
-      }
-   }
-   ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmModule->CONTROLS[ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.chNr].CnV = cnv;
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaPwmDrvr_UpdHwTrigDly
- * \\brief Update Hardware Trigger delay
- * @param hwTrigDly_ns
- * @return - void*/
-/******************************************************************/
-void ActvDchaPwmDrvr_UpdHwTrigDly(uint32 hwTrigDly_ns)
-{
-   uint32 ns_max;
-   uint32 hwTrigDly_ns_lim;
-
-   /* Limit to maximum possible duration for current clock settings */
-   ns_max = ActvDchaPwmDrvr_CountToNsec((uint32)0xFFU,
-         (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.srcClk_Hz / ((uint32)1U << (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.prescaler))));
-
-   if(hwTrigDly_ns > ns_max)
-   {
-      hwTrigDly_ns_lim = ns_max;
-   }
-   else
-   {
-      hwTrigDly_ns_lim = hwTrigDly_ns;
-   }
-
-
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 4 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   SIM_BASE_PTR->SOPT &= ~((uint32)SIM_SOPT_DELAY_MASK);
-   SIM_BASE_PTR->SOPT |= SIM_SOPT_DELAY( ActvDchaPwmDrvr_NsecToCount(hwTrigDly_ns_lim,
-                                  (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.srcClk_Hz / ((uint32)1U << (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.prescaler)))));
-   return;
-}
-
-/******************************************************************/
-/*!
- * \\fn ActvDchaPwmDrvr_GetHwTrigDly
- * \\brief This function gets the configured HW trigger delay in ns from the register value.
- * @param void
- * @return - HW trigger delay in ns */
-/******************************************************************/
-uint32 ActvDchaPwmDrvr_GetHwTrigDly(void)
-{
-   /*! \\misra Warning No C2004:11.3 "A cast should not be performed between a pointer type and an integral type." */
-   /* PRQA S 0306 3 */
-   /* Platform registers are accessed through macros containing pointers on this controller.
-    * As these point to 32bit values this operation is save here. */
-   uint32 soptReg = SIM_BASE_PTR->SOPT;
-
-   soptReg &= SIM_SOPT_DELAY_MASK;
-   soptReg >>= SIM_SOPT_DELAY_SHIFT;
-
-   return  ActvDchaPwmDrvr_CountToNsec(soptReg,
-                        (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.srcClk_Hz / ((uint32)1U << (ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg.prescaler))));
-}

-const ActvDchaPwmDrvr_CfType ActvDchaPwmDrvrPwmCfg = {
-   FtmSystemClk,     /** < clkSrc            : FTM input clock */
-   FtmPrescaleDiv1,  /** < prescaler         : FTM input clock prescaler */
-   FtmPrescaleDiv1,  /** < hwTrigDlyPrescaler: prescaler for HW trigger delay clock */
-   FtmBdmMode3,      /** < bdmMode           : FTM debug mode setting */
-   0x0U,             /** < chInitState       : initial state of FTM channels */
-   0x0U,             /** < chPolarity        : polarity of FTM channels */
-   1100U,            /** < pwmFrq_Hz         : frequency of PWM output in Hz */
-   4000U,            /** < hwTrigDly_ns      : delay for HW trigger in nano seconds */
-   20000000U,        /** < srcClk_Hz         : frequency of FTM input clock in Hz */
-   FtmCh5            /** < chNr              : channel number for pwm output */
-};

-   FtmBdmModeType bdmMode;       /* FTM debug mode setting */
