-/* These are defined by the user (or the compiler)
-   to specify how identifiers are imported from a DLL.
-
-   __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED            Defined if dllimport attribute is supported.
-   __MINGW_IMPORT                  The attribute definition to specify imported
-                                   variables/functions.
-   _CRTIMP                         As above.  For MS compatibility.
-   __MINGW32_VERSION               Runtime version.
-   __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION         Runtime major version.
-   __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION         Runtime minor version.
-   __MINGW32_BUILD_DATE            Runtime build date.
-
-   Macros to enable MinGW features which deviate from standard MSVC
-   compatible behaviour; these may be specified directly in user code,
-   activated implicitly, (e.g. by specifying _POSIX_C_SOURCE or such),
-   or by inclusion in __MINGW_FEATURES__:
-
-   __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO          Select a more ANSI C99 compatible
-                                   implementation of printf() and friends.
-
-   Other macros:
-
-   __int64                         define to be long long.  Using a typedef
-                                   doesn\'t work for "unsigned __int64"
-
-   All headers should include this first, and then use __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-   to choose between the old ``__imp__name\'\' style or __MINGW_IMPORT
-   style declarations.  */
-
-
-/* Manifest definitions identifying the flag bits, controlling activation
- * of MinGW features, as specified by the user in __MINGW_FEATURES__.
- */
-#define __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__\t\t0x0000000000000001ULL
-/*
- * The following three are not yet formally supported; they are
- * included here, to document anticipated future usage.
- */
-#define __MINGW_LC_EXTENSIONS__ \t0x0000000000000050ULL
-#define __MINGW_LC_MESSAGES__\t\t0x0000000000000010ULL
-#define __MINGW_LC_ENVVARS__\t\t0x0000000000000040ULL
-
-/* Try to avoid problems with outdated checks for GCC __attribute__ support.  */
-/* #undef __attribute__ */ /* this undefines special QAC/QAC++ config */
-
-#if defined (__PCC__)
-#  undef __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  define __MINGW_IMPORT extern
-# endif
-# ifndef _CRTIMP
-#  define _CRTIMP
-# endif
-# ifndef __cdecl 
-#  define __cdecl  _Pragma("cdecl")
-# endif
-# ifndef __stdcall
-#  define __stdcall _Pragma("stdcall")
-# endif
-# ifndef __int64
-#  define __int64 long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int32
-#  define __int32 long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int16
-#  define __int16 short
-# endif
-# ifndef __int8
-#  define __int8 char
-# endif
-# ifndef __small
-#  define __small char
-# endif
-# ifndef __hyper
-#  define __hyper long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __volatile__
-#  define __volatile__ volatile
-# endif
-# ifndef __restrict__
-#  define __restrict__ restrict
-# endif
-# define NONAMELESSUNION
-#elif defined(__GNUC__)
-# ifdef __declspec
-#  ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-   /* Note the extern. This is needed to work around GCC\'s
-      limitations in handling dllimport attribute.  */
-#   define __MINGW_IMPORT  extern __attribute__ ((__dllimport__))
-#  endif
-#  ifndef _CRTIMP
-#   ifdef __USE_CRTIMP
-#    define _CRTIMP  __attribute__ ((dllimport))
-#   else
-#    define _CRTIMP
-#   endif
-#  endif
-#  define __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# else /* __declspec */
-#  undef __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-#  undef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  ifndef _CRTIMP
-#   define _CRTIMP
-#  endif
-# endif /* __declspec */
-/*
- * The next two defines can cause problems if user code adds the
- * __cdecl attribute like so:
- * void __attribute__ ((__cdecl)) foo(void); 
- */
-# ifndef __cdecl 
-#  define __cdecl  __attribute__ ((__cdecl__))
-# endif
-# ifndef __stdcall
-#  define __stdcall __attribute__ ((__stdcall__))
-# endif
-# ifndef __int64
-#  define __int64 long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int32
-#  define __int32 long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int16
-#  define __int16 short
-# endif
-# ifndef __int8
-#  define __int8 char
-# endif
-# ifndef __small
-#  define __small char
-# endif
-# ifndef __hyper
-#  define __hyper long long
-# endif
-#else /* ! __GNUC__ && ! __PCC__ */
-# ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  define __MINGW_IMPORT  __declspec(dllimport)
-# endif
-# ifndef _CRTIMP
-#  define _CRTIMP  __declspec(dllimport)
-# endif
-# define __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# define __attribute__(x) /* nothing */
-#endif
-
-#if defined (__GNUC__) && defined (__GNUC_MINOR__)
-#define __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ(major, minor) \\
-  (__GNUC__ > (major) \\
-   || (__GNUC__ == (major) && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= (minor)))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ(major, minor)  0
-#endif

-# define __CRT_INLINE inline
-#else

-#  define __CRT_INLINE extern __inline__
-# endif
-#endif

-# else

-#else

-# endif

-#ifndef GENERIC_FI_H
-#define GENERIC_FI_H
-
-/* Compilers may use another function within the assert macro to exit the 
- * program. QAC thus does not see an "exit" function and assumes the 
- * function returns, which it does not.
- * The below pragma tells QAC the compiler supplied function does not
- * return.
- */
-
-/* examples - GCC, ICC, BCC 3.1, BCC 5.5, CYGWIN gcc, Watcom 1.6 */
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_perror_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert
-
-/* Depending on the code that the compiler maker uses within the assert macro,
- * QAC may issue warnings. It is also possible that when the NDEBUG macro is used
- * to suppress the assertion code, QAC may issue a "no side-effects" warning.
- * To eliminate these, we turn off all warnings for the assert macro.
- */
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "assert"
-
-
-/* Any other items that may be required in a "force-include" file should
- * be placed below.
- */
-
-/* to avoid problems with GCC using builtin functions for va_start
- * and QAC issuing unset variable warnings.
- */
-typedef void * __builtin_va_list;
-#define __builtin_va_start(ap, parmN)\t((void)((ap)= &(parmN)))
-#define __builtin_va_arg(ap, type)\t(*(type*)(ap))
-#define __builtin_va_end(ap)\t\t((void)((ap)=0))
-#define __builtin_va_copy(d,s)
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "va_end"
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "__va_copy"
-
-#define  __builtin_offsetof(type, member) ((size_t) &((type *)0)->member)
-
-/* these defines are used here because GCC uses builtin functions to speed
- * the operation. The below are generic defines.
- */
-#ifndef FD_SET
-#define fds_bits __fds_bits
-#define FD_SETSIZE      (sizeof(fd_set) * 8)
-#define FD_SET(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] |= (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_CLR(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] &= ~(1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ISSET(n, p)  (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] & (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ZERO(p)      memset((p), 0, sizeof(*(p)))
-#endif
-
-/* The contents below are actually from GCC limits header but were only
- * to be used if the header was to be used with a non-GCC compiler. If
- * __GNUC__ is defined, an "include_next" directive is used which QAC does not 
- * support as yet.
- */
-
-/* Number of bits in a \'char\'.\t*/
-#ifndef CHAR_BIT
-#define CHAR_BIT\t8
-#endif
-
-#ifndef SCHAR_MIN
-/* Minimum and maximum values a `signed char\' can hold.  */
-#define SCHAR_MIN\t(-128)
-#define SCHAR_MAX\t127
-#endif
-
-#ifndef UCHAR_MAX
-/* Maximum value an `unsigned char\' can hold.  (Minimum is 0.)  */
-#define UCHAR_MAX\t255
-#endif
-
-/* Minimum and maximum values a `char\' can hold.  */
-#ifdef __CHAR_UNSIGNED__
-#define CHAR_MIN\t0
-#define CHAR_MAX\tUCHAR_MAX
-#else
-#define CHAR_MIN\tSCHAR_MIN
-#define CHAR_MAX\tSCHAR_MAX
-#endif
-
-#ifndef SHRT_MIN
-/* Minimum and maximum values a `signed short int\' can hold.  */
-#define SHRT_MIN\t(-32768)
-#define SHRT_MAX\t32767
-#endif
-

-/* Maximum value an `unsigned short int\' can hold.  (Minimum is 0.)  */
-#define USHRT_MAX\t65535
-#endif
-
-#ifndef INT_MIN

-#define INT_MIN\t(-INT_MAX - 1)
-#define INT_MAX\t2147483647
-#endif
-
-#ifndef UINT_MAX
-/* Maximum value an `unsigned int\' can hold.  (Minimum is 0.)  */
-#define UINT_MAX\t4294967295U
-#endif

-#define __MINGW32_VERSION           3.20
-#define __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION     3
-#define __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION     20
-#define __MINGW32_PATCHLEVEL        0
-

-#ifndef __PCC__
-#pragma GCC system_header
-#endif

-/* These are defined by the user (or the compiler)
-   to specify how identifiers are imported from a DLL.
-
-   __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED            Defined if dllimport attribute is supported.
-   __MINGW_IMPORT                  The attribute definition to specify imported
-                                   variables/functions.
-   _CRTIMP                         As above.  For MS compatibility.
-   __MINGW32_VERSION               Runtime version.
-   __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION         Runtime major version.
-   __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION         Runtime minor version.
-   __MINGW32_BUILD_DATE            Runtime build date.
-
-   Macros to enable MinGW features which deviate from standard MSVC
-   compatible behaviour; these may be specified directly in user code,
-   activated implicitly, (e.g. by specifying _POSIX_C_SOURCE or such),
-   or by inclusion in __MINGW_FEATURES__:
-
-   __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO          Select a more ANSI C99 compatible
-                                   implementation of printf() and friends.
-
-   Other macros:
-
-   __int64                         define to be long long.  Using a typedef
-                                   doesn\'t work for "unsigned __int64"
-
-   All headers should include this first, and then use __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-   to choose between the old ``__imp__name\'\' style or __MINGW_IMPORT
-   style declarations.  */
-
-
-/* Manifest definitions identifying the flag bits, controlling activation
- * of MinGW features, as specified by the user in __MINGW_FEATURES__.
- */
-#define __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__\t\t0x0000000000000001ULL
-/*
- * The following three are not yet formally supported; they are

-

-/* #undef __attribute__ */ /* this undefines special QAC/QAC++ config */

-#define\tEOVERFLOW\t75\t/* Value too large for defined data type */

-#define\tELIBMAX\t\t82\t/* Attempting to link in too many shared libraries */
-#define\tELIBEXEC\t83\t/* Cannot exec a shared library directly */

-#define\tESTRPIPE\t86\t/* Streams pipe error */

-#define\tENOTSOCK\t88\t/* Socket operation on non-socket */
-#define\tEDESTADDRREQ\t89\t/* Destination address required */
-#define\tEMSGSIZE\t90\t/* Message too long */
-#define\tEPROTOTYPE\t91\t/* Protocol wrong type for socket */
-#define\tENOPROTOOPT\t92\t/* Protocol not available */
-#define\tEPROTONOSUPPORT\t93\t/* Protocol not supported */
-#define\tESOCKTNOSUPPORT\t94\t/* Socket type not supported */

-#define\tEPFNOSUPPORT\t96\t/* Protocol family not supported */
-#define\tEAFNOSUPPORT\t97\t/* Address family not supported by protocol */
-#define\tEADDRINUSE\t98\t/* Address already in use */
-#define\tEADDRNOTAVAIL\t99\t/* Cannot assign requested address */

-#define\tENETUNREACH\t101\t/* Network is unreachable */

-#define\tECONNRESET\t104\t/* Connection reset by peer */
-#define\tENOBUFS\t\t105\t/* No buffer space available */

-#define\tENOTCONN\t107\t/* Transport endpoint is not connected */

-#define\tETOOMANYREFS\t109\t/* Too many references: cannot splice */

-#  define ENOTRECOVERABLE\t131

-extern int *__errno_location (void) __THROW __attribute__ ((__const__));

- * pointer warning by QAC

-#endif
-#endif

-#ifndef GENERIC_FI_H
-#define GENERIC_FI_H
-
-/* Compilers may use another function within the assert macro to exit the 
- * program. QAC thus does not see an "exit" function and assumes the 
- * function returns, which it does not.
- * The below pragma tells QAC the compiler supplied function does not
- * return.
- */
-
-/* examples - GCC, ICC, BCC 3.1, BCC 5.5, CYGWIN gcc, Watcom 1.6 */
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_perror_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert
-
-/* Depending on the code that the compiler maker uses within the assert macro,
- * QAC may issue warnings. It is also possible that when the NDEBUG macro is used
- * to suppress the assertion code, QAC may issue a "no side-effects" warning.
- * To eliminate these, we turn off all warnings for the assert macro.
- */
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "assert"
-
-
-/* Any other items that may be required in a "force-include" file should
- * be placed below.
- */
-
-/* to avoid problems with GCC using builtin functions for va_start
- * and QAC issuing unset variable warnings.
- */
-typedef void * __builtin_va_list;
-#define __builtin_va_start(ap, parmN)\t((void)((ap)= &(parmN)))
-#define __builtin_va_arg(ap, type)\t(*(type*)(ap))
-#define __builtin_va_end(ap)\t\t((void)((ap)=0))
-#define __builtin_va_copy(d,s)
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "va_end"
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "__va_copy"
-
-#define  __builtin_offsetof(type, member) ((size_t) &((type *)0)->member)
-
-/* these defines are used here because GCC uses builtin functions to speed
- * the operation. The below are generic defines.
- */
-#ifndef FD_SET
-#define fds_bits __fds_bits
-#define FD_SETSIZE      (sizeof(fd_set) * 8)
-#define FD_SET(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] |= (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_CLR(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] &= ~(1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ISSET(n, p)  (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] & (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ZERO(p)      memset((p), 0, sizeof(*(p)))
-#endif
-
-/* The contents below are actually from GCC limits header but were only
- * to be used if the header was to be used with a non-GCC compiler. If
- * __GNUC__ is defined, an "include_next" directive is used which QAC does not 
- * support as yet.
- */

-/* Number of bits in a \'char\'.\t*/
-#ifndef CHAR_BIT
-#define CHAR_BIT\t8
-#endif

-#define SCHAR_MAX\t127
-#endif
-
-#ifndef UCHAR_MAX

-#define UCHAR_MAX\t255
-#endif
-

-#ifdef __CHAR_UNSIGNED__
-#define CHAR_MIN\t0
-#define CHAR_MAX\tUCHAR_MAX
-#else
-#define CHAR_MIN\tSCHAR_MIN
-#define CHAR_MAX\tSCHAR_MAX
-#endif
-

-#define SHRT_MAX\t32767
-#endif

-#define USHRT_MAX\t65535
-#endif
-

-#define INT_MAX\t2147483647
-#endif
-
-#ifndef UINT_MAX
-/* Maximum value an `unsigned int\' can hold.  (Minimum is 0.)  */
-#define UINT_MAX\t4294967295U
-#endif
-

-#if __WORDSIZE == 64

-#else
-#define LONG_MAX\t2147483647L
-#endif

-#ifndef __MINGW_H

-#define __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION     3
-#define __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION     20
-#define __MINGW32_PATCHLEVEL        0
-

-#ifndef __PCC__
-#pragma GCC system_header
-#endif
-#endif
-
-/* These are defined by the user (or the compiler)
-   to specify how identifiers are imported from a DLL.
-
-   __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED            Defined if dllimport attribute is supported.
-   __MINGW_IMPORT                  The attribute definition to specify imported
-                                   variables/functions.
-   _CRTIMP                         As above.  For MS compatibility.
-   __MINGW32_VERSION               Runtime version.
-   __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION         Runtime major version.
-   __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION         Runtime minor version.
-   __MINGW32_BUILD_DATE            Runtime build date.
-
-   Macros to enable MinGW features which deviate from standard MSVC
-   compatible behaviour; these may be specified directly in user code,
-   activated implicitly, (e.g. by specifying _POSIX_C_SOURCE or such),
-   or by inclusion in __MINGW_FEATURES__:
-
-   __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO          Select a more ANSI C99 compatible
-                                   implementation of printf() and friends.
-
-   Other macros:
-
-   __int64                         define to be long long.  Using a typedef
-                                   doesn\'t work for "unsigned __int64"
-
-   All headers should include this first, and then use __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-   to choose between the old ``__imp__name\'\' style or __MINGW_IMPORT
-   style declarations.  */
-
-
-/* Manifest definitions identifying the flag bits, controlling activation
- * of MinGW features, as specified by the user in __MINGW_FEATURES__.
- */
-#define __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__\t\t0x0000000000000001ULL

-   errors with  --traditional-cpp.  */

-/* TODO: Mark (almost) all CRT functions as __MINGW_NOTHROW.  This will

-
-#ifndef __MSVCRT_VERSION__
-/*  High byte is the major version, low byte is the minor. */
-# define __MSVCRT_VERSION__ 0x0600
-#endif
-
-/* Activation of MinGW specific extended features:
- */
-#ifndef __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO
-/*
- * If user didn\'t specify it explicitly...
- */
-# if   defined __STRICT_ANSI__  ||  defined _ISOC99_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _POSIX_SOURCE    ||  defined _POSIX_C_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _XOPEN_SOURCE    ||  defined _XOPEN_SOURCE_EXTENDED \\
-   ||  defined _GNU_SOURCE      ||  defined _BSD_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _SVID_SOURCE
-   /*
-    * but where any of these source code qualifiers are specified,
-    * then assume ANSI I/O standards are preferred over Microsoft\'s...
-    */
-#  define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO    1
-# else
-   /*
-    * otherwise use whatever __MINGW_FEATURES__ specifies...
-    */
-#  define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO    (__MINGW_FEATURES__ & __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__)
-# endif
-#endif

-#ifndef GENERIC_FI_H
-#define GENERIC_FI_H
-
-/* Compilers may use another function within the assert macro to exit the 
- * program. QAC thus does not see an "exit" function and assumes the 
- * function returns, which it does not.
- * The below pragma tells QAC the compiler supplied function does not
- * return.
- */
-
-/* examples - GCC, ICC, BCC 3.1, BCC 5.5, CYGWIN gcc, Watcom 1.6 */
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_perror_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert
-
-/* Depending on the code that the compiler maker uses within the assert macro,
- * QAC may issue warnings. It is also possible that when the NDEBUG macro is used
- * to suppress the assertion code, QAC may issue a "no side-effects" warning.
- * To eliminate these, we turn off all warnings for the assert macro.
- */
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "assert"
-
-
-/* Any other items that may be required in a "force-include" file should
- * be placed below.
- */
-
-/* to avoid problems with GCC using builtin functions for va_start
- * and QAC issuing unset variable warnings.
- */
-typedef void * __builtin_va_list;
-#define __builtin_va_start(ap, parmN)\t((void)((ap)= &(parmN)))
-#define __builtin_va_arg(ap, type)\t(*(type*)(ap))
-#define __builtin_va_end(ap)\t\t((void)((ap)=0))
-#define __builtin_va_copy(d,s)
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "va_end"
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "__va_copy"
-
-#define  __builtin_offsetof(type, member) ((size_t) &((type *)0)->member)
-
-/* these defines are used here because GCC uses builtin functions to speed
- * the operation. The below are generic defines.
- */
-#ifndef FD_SET
-#define fds_bits __fds_bits
-#define FD_SETSIZE      (sizeof(fd_set) * 8)
-#define FD_SET(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] |= (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_CLR(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] &= ~(1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ISSET(n, p)  (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] & (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ZERO(p)      memset((p), 0, sizeof(*(p)))
-#endif
-
-/* The contents below are actually from GCC limits header but were only
- * to be used if the header was to be used with a non-GCC compiler. If
- * __GNUC__ is defined, an "include_next" directive is used which QAC does not 
- * support as yet.
- */
-
-/* Number of bits in a \'char\'.\t*/
-#ifndef CHAR_BIT
-#define CHAR_BIT\t8
-#endif

-#define SCHAR_MIN\t(-128)
-#define SCHAR_MAX\t127
-#endif
-

-#define UCHAR_MAX\t255
-#endif
-

-#ifdef __CHAR_UNSIGNED__
-#define CHAR_MIN\t0
-#define CHAR_MAX\tUCHAR_MAX
-#else
-#define CHAR_MIN\tSCHAR_MIN
-#define CHAR_MAX\tSCHAR_MAX
-#endif
-

-#define SHRT_MIN\t(-32768)
-#define SHRT_MAX\t32767
-#endif

-/* Maximum value an `unsigned int\' can hold.  (Minimum is 0.)  */
-#define UINT_MAX\t4294967295U
-#endif

-#ifndef __MINGW_H
-/*

-#define __MINGW_H
-
-#define __MINGW32_VERSION           3.20
-#define __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION     3
-#define __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION     20
-#define __MINGW32_PATCHLEVEL        0
-
-#if __GNUC__ >= 3
-#ifndef __PCC__
-#pragma GCC system_header
-#endif
-#endif
-
-/* These are defined by the user (or the compiler)
-   to specify how identifiers are imported from a DLL.
-
-   __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED            Defined if dllimport attribute is supported.
-   __MINGW_IMPORT                  The attribute definition to specify imported
-                                   variables/functions.
-   _CRTIMP                         As above.  For MS compatibility.
-   __MINGW32_VERSION               Runtime version.
-   __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION         Runtime major version.
-   __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION         Runtime minor version.
-   __MINGW32_BUILD_DATE            Runtime build date.
-
-   Macros to enable MinGW features which deviate from standard MSVC
-   compatible behaviour; these may be specified directly in user code,
-   activated implicitly, (e.g. by specifying _POSIX_C_SOURCE or such),
-   or by inclusion in __MINGW_FEATURES__:
-
-   __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO          Select a more ANSI C99 compatible
-                                   implementation of printf() and friends.
-
-   Other macros:
-
-   __int64                         define to be long long.  Using a typedef
-                                   doesn\'t work for "unsigned __int64"
-
-   All headers should include this first, and then use __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-   to choose between the old ``__imp__name\'\' style or __MINGW_IMPORT
-   style declarations.  */
-
-
-/* Manifest definitions identifying the flag bits, controlling activation
- * of MinGW features, as specified by the user in __MINGW_FEATURES__.
- */
-#define __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__\t\t0x0000000000000001ULL
-/*
- * The following three are not yet formally supported; they are
- * included here, to document anticipated future usage.
- */
-#define __MINGW_LC_EXTENSIONS__ \t0x0000000000000050ULL
-#define __MINGW_LC_MESSAGES__\t\t0x0000000000000010ULL
-#define __MINGW_LC_ENVVARS__\t\t0x0000000000000040ULL
-
-/* Try to avoid problems with outdated checks for GCC __attribute__ support.  */
-/* #undef __attribute__ */ /* this undefines special QAC/QAC++ config */
-
-#if defined (__PCC__)
-#  undef __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  define __MINGW_IMPORT extern
-# endif
-# ifndef _CRTIMP
-#  define _CRTIMP
-# endif
-# ifndef __cdecl 
-#  define __cdecl  _Pragma("cdecl")
-# endif
-# ifndef __stdcall
-#  define __stdcall _Pragma("stdcall")
-# endif
-# ifndef __int64
-#  define __int64 long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int32
-#  define __int32 long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int16
-#  define __int16 short
-# endif
-# ifndef __int8
-#  define __int8 char
-# endif
-# ifndef __small
-#  define __small char
-# endif
-# ifndef __hyper
-#  define __hyper long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __volatile__
-#  define __volatile__ volatile
-# endif
-# ifndef __restrict__
-#  define __restrict__ restrict
-# endif
-# define NONAMELESSUNION
-#elif defined(__GNUC__)
-# ifdef __declspec
-#  ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-   /* Note the extern. This is needed to work around GCC\'s
-      limitations in handling dllimport attribute.  */
-#   define __MINGW_IMPORT  extern __attribute__ ((__dllimport__))
-#  endif
-#  ifndef _CRTIMP
-#   ifdef __USE_CRTIMP
-#    define _CRTIMP  __attribute__ ((dllimport))
-#   else
-#    define _CRTIMP
-#   endif
-#  endif
-#  define __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# else /* __declspec */
-#  undef __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-#  undef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  ifndef _CRTIMP
-#   define _CRTIMP
-#  endif
-# endif /* __declspec */
-/*
- * The next two defines can cause problems if user code adds the
- * __cdecl attribute like so:
- * void __attribute__ ((__cdecl)) foo(void); 
- */
-# ifndef __cdecl 
-#  define __cdecl  __attribute__ ((__cdecl__))
-# endif
-# ifndef __stdcall
-#  define __stdcall __attribute__ ((__stdcall__))
-# endif
-# ifndef __int64
-#  define __int64 long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int32
-#  define __int32 long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int16
-#  define __int16 short
-# endif
-# ifndef __int8
-#  define __int8 char
-# endif
-# ifndef __small
-#  define __small char
-# endif
-# ifndef __hyper
-#  define __hyper long long
-# endif
-#else /* ! __GNUC__ && ! __PCC__ */
-# ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  define __MINGW_IMPORT  __declspec(dllimport)
-# endif
-# ifndef _CRTIMP
-#  define _CRTIMP  __declspec(dllimport)
-# endif
-# define __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# define __attribute__(x) /* nothing */
-#endif

-#if defined (__GNUC__) && defined (__GNUC_MINOR__)
-#define __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ(major, minor) \\
-  (__GNUC__ > (major) \\
-   || (__GNUC__ == (major) && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= (minor)))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ(major, minor)  0
-#endif
-
-#ifdef __cplusplus
-# define __CRT_INLINE inline
-#else
-# if __GNUC_STDC_INLINE__
-#  define __CRT_INLINE extern inline __attribute__((__gnu_inline__))
-# else
-#  define __CRT_INLINE extern __inline__
-# endif
-#endif
-
-# ifdef __GNUC__
-#  define _CRTALIAS __CRT_INLINE __attribute__ ((__always_inline__))
-# else
-#  define _CRTALIAS __CRT_INLINE
-# endif
-
-#ifdef __cplusplus
-# define __UNUSED_PARAM(x)
-#else
-# ifdef __GNUC__
-#  define __UNUSED_PARAM(x) x __attribute__ ((__unused__))
-# else
-#  define __UNUSED_PARAM(x) x
-# endif
-#endif
-
-#ifdef __GNUC__
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NORETURN __attribute__ ((__noreturn__))
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_CONST __attribute__ ((__const__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NORETURN
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_CONST
-#endif
-
-#if __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 0)
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_MALLOC __attribute__ ((__malloc__))
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_PURE __attribute__ ((__pure__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_MALLOC
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_PURE
-#endif
-
-/* Attribute `nonnull\' was valid as of gcc 3.3.  We don\'t use GCC\'s
-   variadiac macro facility, because variadic macros cause syntax
-   errors with  --traditional-cpp.  */
-#if  __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 3)
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NONNULL(arg) __attribute__ ((__nonnull__ (arg)))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NONNULL(arg)
-#endif /* GNUC >= 3.3 */
-
-#if  __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 1)
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_DEPRECATED __attribute__ ((__deprecated__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_DEPRECATED
-#endif /* GNUC >= 3.1 */
- 
-#if  __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 3)
-#define __MINGW_NOTHROW __attribute__ ((__nothrow__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_NOTHROW
-#endif /* GNUC >= 3.3 */
-
-
-/* TODO: Mark (almost) all CRT functions as __MINGW_NOTHROW.  This will
-allow GCC to optimize away some EH unwind code, at least in DW2 case.  */
-
-#ifndef __MSVCRT_VERSION__
-/*  High byte is the major version, low byte is the minor. */
-# define __MSVCRT_VERSION__ 0x0600
-#endif
-
-/* Activation of MinGW specific extended features:
- */
-#ifndef __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO
-/*
- * If user didn\'t specify it explicitly...
- */
-# if   defined __STRICT_ANSI__  ||  defined _ISOC99_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _POSIX_SOURCE    ||  defined _POSIX_C_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _XOPEN_SOURCE    ||  defined _XOPEN_SOURCE_EXTENDED \\
-   ||  defined _GNU_SOURCE      ||  defined _BSD_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _SVID_SOURCE
-   /*
-    * but where any of these source code qualifiers are specified,
-    * then assume ANSI I/O standards are preferred over Microsoft\'s...
-    */
-#  define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO    1
-# else
-   /*
-    * otherwise use whatever __MINGW_FEATURES__ specifies...
-    */
-#  define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO    (__MINGW_FEATURES__ & __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__)
-# endif
-#endif
-
-#endif /* __MINGW_H */

-#define\tEPERM\t\t 1\t/* Operation not permitted */
-#define\tENOENT\t\t 2\t/* No such file or directory */
-#define\tESRCH\t\t 3\t/* No such process */
-#define\tEINTR\t\t 4\t/* Interrupted system call */
-#define\tEIO\t\t 5\t/* I/O error */
-#define\tENXIO\t\t 6\t/* No such device or address */
-#define\tE2BIG\t\t 7\t/* Arg list too long */
-#define\tENOEXEC\t\t 8\t/* Exec format error */
-#define\tEBADF\t\t 9\t/* Bad file number */
-#define\tECHILD\t\t10\t/* No child processes */
-#define\tEAGAIN\t\t11\t/* Try again */

-#define\tEACCES\t\t13\t/* Permission denied */
-#define\tEFAULT\t\t14\t/* Bad address */
-#define\tENOTBLK\t\t15\t/* Block device required */
-#define\tEBUSY\t\t16\t/* Device or resource busy */
-#define\tEEXIST\t\t17\t/* File exists */
-#define\tEXDEV\t\t18\t/* Cross-device link */
-#define\tENODEV\t\t19\t/* No such device */
-#define\tENOTDIR\t\t20\t/* Not a directory */
-#define\tEISDIR\t\t21\t/* Is a directory */

-#define\tENFILE\t\t23\t/* File table overflow */
-#define\tEMFILE\t\t24\t/* Too many open files */
-#define\tENOTTY\t\t25\t/* Not a typewriter */
-#define\tETXTBSY\t\t26\t/* Text file busy */
-#define\tEFBIG\t\t27\t/* File too large */
-#define\tENOSPC\t\t28\t/* No space left on device */
-#define\tESPIPE\t\t29\t/* Illegal seek */
-#define\tEROFS\t\t30\t/* Read-only file system */
-#define\tEMLINK\t\t31\t/* Too many links */
-#define\tEPIPE\t\t32\t/* Broken pipe */
-#define\tEDOM\t\t33\t/* Math argument out of domain of func */
-#define\tERANGE\t\t34\t/* Math result not representable */
-#define\tEDEADLK\t\t35\t/* Resource deadlock would occur */
-#define\tENAMETOOLONG\t36\t/* File name too long */
-#define\tENOLCK\t\t37\t/* No record locks available */
-#define\tENOSYS\t\t38\t/* Function not implemented */
-#define\tENOTEMPTY\t39\t/* Directory not empty */
-#define\tELOOP\t\t40\t/* Too many symbolic links encountered */
-#define\tEWOULDBLOCK\tEAGAIN\t/* Operation would block */
-#define\tENOMSG\t\t42\t/* No message of desired type */
-#define\tEIDRM\t\t43\t/* Identifier removed */
-#define\tECHRNG\t\t44\t/* Channel number out of range */
-#define\tEL2NSYNC\t45\t/* Level 2 not synchronized */
-#define\tEL3HLT\t\t46\t/* Level 3 halted */
-#define\tEL3RST\t\t47\t/* Level 3 reset */
-#define\tELNRNG\t\t48\t/* Link number out of range */
-#define\tEUNATCH\t\t49\t/* Protocol driver not attached */
-#define\tENOCSI\t\t50\t/* No CSI structure available */
-#define\tEL2HLT\t\t51\t/* Level 2 halted */
-#define\tEBADE\t\t52\t/* Invalid exchange */
-#define\tEBADR\t\t53\t/* Invalid request descriptor */
-#define\tEXFULL\t\t54\t/* Exchange full */
-#define\tENOANO\t\t55\t/* No anode */
-#define\tEBADRQC\t\t56\t/* Invalid request code */
-#define\tEBADSLT\t\t57\t/* Invalid slot */
-
-#define\tEDEADLOCK\tEDEADLK
-
-#define\tEBFONT\t\t59\t/* Bad font file format */
-#define\tENOSTR\t\t60\t/* Device not a stream */
-#define\tENODATA\t\t61\t/* No data available */
-#define\tETIME\t\t62\t/* Timer expired */
-#define\tENOSR\t\t63\t/* Out of streams resources */
-#define\tENONET\t\t64\t/* Machine is not on the network */
-#define\tENOPKG\t\t65\t/* Package not installed */
-#define\tEREMOTE\t\t66\t/* Object is remote */
-#define\tENOLINK\t\t67\t/* Link has been severed */
-#define\tEADV\t\t68\t/* Advertise error */
-#define\tESRMNT\t\t69\t/* Srmount error */
-#define\tECOMM\t\t70\t/* Communication error on send */
-#define\tEPROTO\t\t71\t/* Protocol error */
-#define\tEMULTIHOP\t72\t/* Multihop attempted */
-#define\tEDOTDOT\t\t73\t/* RFS specific error */
-#define\tEBADMSG\t\t74\t/* Not a data message */
-#define\tEOVERFLOW\t75\t/* Value too large for defined data type */
-#define\tENOTUNIQ\t76\t/* Name not unique on network */
-#define\tEBADFD\t\t77\t/* File descriptor in bad state */
-#define\tEREMCHG\t\t78\t/* Remote address changed */
-#define\tELIBACC\t\t79\t/* Can not access a needed shared library */
-#define\tELIBBAD\t\t80\t/* Accessing a corrupted shared library */
-#define\tELIBSCN\t\t81\t/* .lib section in a.out corrupted */
-#define\tELIBMAX\t\t82\t/* Attempting to link in too many shared libraries */
-#define\tELIBEXEC\t83\t/* Cannot exec a shared library directly */
-#define\tEILSEQ\t\t84\t/* Illegal byte sequence */
-#define\tERESTART\t85\t/* Interrupted system call should be restarted */
-#define\tESTRPIPE\t86\t/* Streams pipe error */
-#define\tEUSERS\t\t87\t/* Too many users */
-#define\tENOTSOCK\t88\t/* Socket operation on non-socket */
-#define\tEDESTADDRREQ\t89\t/* Destination address required */
-#define\tEMSGSIZE\t90\t/* Message too long */
-#define\tEPROTOTYPE\t91\t/* Protocol wrong type for socket */
-#define\tENOPROTOOPT\t92\t/* Protocol not available */
-#define\tEPROTONOSUPPORT\t93\t/* Protocol not supported */
-#define\tESOCKTNOSUPPORT\t94\t/* Socket type not supported */
-#define\tEOPNOTSUPP\t95\t/* Operation not supported on transport endpoint */
-#define\tEPFNOSUPPORT\t96\t/* Protocol family not supported */
-#define\tEAFNOSUPPORT\t97\t/* Address family not supported by protocol */
-#define\tEADDRINUSE\t98\t/* Address already in use */
-#define\tEADDRNOTAVAIL\t99\t/* Cannot assign requested address */
-#define\tENETDOWN\t100\t/* Network is down */
-#define\tENETUNREACH\t101\t/* Network is unreachable */
-#define\tENETRESET\t102\t/* Network dropped connection because of reset */
-#define\tECONNABORTED\t103\t/* Software caused connection abort */
-#define\tECONNRESET\t104\t/* Connection reset by peer */
-#define\tENOBUFS\t\t105\t/* No buffer space available */
-#define\tEISCONN\t\t106\t/* Transport endpoint is already connected */
-#define\tENOTCONN\t107\t/* Transport endpoint is not connected */
-#define\tESHUTDOWN\t108\t/* Cannot send after transport endpoint shutdown */
-#define\tETOOMANYREFS\t109\t/* Too many references: cannot splice */
-#define\tETIMEDOUT\t110\t/* Connection timed out */
-#define\tECONNREFUSED\t111\t/* Connection refused */
-#define\tEHOSTDOWN\t112\t/* Host is down */
-#define\tEHOSTUNREACH\t113\t/* No route to host */
-#define\tEALREADY\t114\t/* Operation already in progress */
-#define\tEINPROGRESS\t115\t/* Operation now in progress */
-#define\tESTALE\t\t116\t/* Stale NFS file handle */
-#define\tEUCLEAN\t\t117\t/* Structure needs cleaning */
-#define\tENOTNAM\t\t118\t/* Not a XENIX named type file */
-#define\tENAVAIL\t\t119\t/* No XENIX semaphores available */
-#define\tEISNAM\t\t120\t/* Is a named type file */
-#define\tEREMOTEIO\t121\t/* Remote I/O error */
-#define\tEDQUOT\t\t122\t/* Quota exceeded */
-
-#define\tENOMEDIUM\t123\t/* No medium found */
-#define\tEMEDIUMTYPE\t124\t/* Wrong medium type */

-#endif

-#ifdef _ERRNO_H
-
-# undef EDOM
-# undef EILSEQ

-/* Linux has no ENOTSUP error code.  */
-# define ENOTSUP EOPNOTSUPP
-
-/* Older Linux versions also had no ECANCELED error code.  */
-# ifndef ECANCELED
-#  define ECANCELED\t125

-

-# ifndef EOWNERDEAD
-#  define EOWNERDEAD\t\t130
-#  define ENOTRECOVERABLE\t131
-# endif

-
-#ifndef PRL_01
-/* Function to get address of global `errno\' variable.  */
-extern int *__errno_location (void) __THROW __attribute__ ((__const__));
-
-#  if !defined _LIBC || defined _LIBC_REENTRANT
-/* When using threads, errno is a per-thread value.  */
-#   define errno (*__errno_location ())
-#  endif
-#else
-/* This is to prevent a dereferencing of a possible null
- * pointer warning by QAC
- */
-#ifndef\terrno
-extern int errno;
-#endif
-#endif
-
-# endif /* !__ASSEMBLER__ */

-# define EILSEQ\t84\t/* Illegal byte sequence.  */
-# define ERANGE\t34\t/* Math result not representable.  */

-/*
- *\tISO C99 Standard: 7.5 Errors\t<errno.h>

-
-#ifndef\t_ERRNO_H
-
-/* The includer defined __need_Emath if he wants only the definitions
-   of EDOM and ERANGE, and not everything else.  */
-#ifndef\t__need_Emath
-# define _ERRNO_H\t1
-# include <features.h>

-
-/* Get the error number constants from the system-specific file.
-   This file will test __need_Emath and _ERRNO_H.  */
-#include <bits/errno.h>
-#undef\t__need_Emath
-
-#ifdef\t_ERRNO_H
-
-/* Declare the `errno\' variable, unless it\'s defined as a macro by
-   bits/errno.h.  This is the case in GNU, where it is a per-thread
-   variable.  This redeclaration using the macro still works, but it
-   will be a function declaration without a prototype and may trigger
-   a -Wstrict-prototypes warning.  */
-#ifndef\terrno
-extern int errno;
-#endif

-extern char *program_invocation_name, *program_invocation_short_name;
-#endif /* __USE_GNU */
-#endif /* _ERRNO_H */

-__END_DECLS

-#endif /* _ERRNO_H */

-#ifndef GENERIC_FI_H
-#define GENERIC_FI_H
-
-/* Compilers may use another function within the assert macro to exit the 
- * program. QAC thus does not see an "exit" function and assumes the 
- * function returns, which it does not.
- * The below pragma tells QAC the compiler supplied function does not
- * return.
- */
-
-/* examples - GCC, ICC, BCC 3.1, BCC 5.5, CYGWIN gcc, Watcom 1.6 */
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_perror_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert
-
-/* Depending on the code that the compiler maker uses within the assert macro,
- * QAC may issue warnings. It is also possible that when the NDEBUG macro is used
- * to suppress the assertion code, QAC may issue a "no side-effects" warning.
- * To eliminate these, we turn off all warnings for the assert macro.
- */
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "assert"
-
-
-/* Any other items that may be required in a "force-include" file should
- * be placed below.
- */
-
-/* to avoid problems with GCC using builtin functions for va_start
- * and QAC issuing unset variable warnings.
- */
-typedef void * __builtin_va_list;
-#define __builtin_va_start(ap, parmN)\t((void)((ap)= &(parmN)))
-#define __builtin_va_arg(ap, type)\t(*(type*)(ap))
-#define __builtin_va_end(ap)\t\t((void)((ap)=0))
-#define __builtin_va_copy(d,s)
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "va_end"
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "__va_copy"
-
-#define  __builtin_offsetof(type, member) ((size_t) &((type *)0)->member)
-
-/* these defines are used here because GCC uses builtin functions to speed
- * the operation. The below are generic defines.
- */
-#ifndef FD_SET
-#define fds_bits __fds_bits
-#define FD_SETSIZE      (sizeof(fd_set) * 8)
-#define FD_SET(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] |= (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_CLR(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] &= ~(1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ISSET(n, p)  (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] & (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ZERO(p)      memset((p), 0, sizeof(*(p)))
-#endif
-
-/* The contents below are actually from GCC limits header but were only
- * to be used if the header was to be used with a non-GCC compiler. If
- * __GNUC__ is defined, an "include_next" directive is used which QAC does not

-#define __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION     3
-#define __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION     20
-#define __MINGW32_PATCHLEVEL        0
-

-#ifndef __PCC__
-#pragma GCC system_header
-#endif

-
-/* These are defined by the user (or the compiler)
-   to specify how identifiers are imported from a DLL.
-
-   __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED            Defined if dllimport attribute is supported.
-   __MINGW_IMPORT                  The attribute definition to specify imported
-                                   variables/functions.
-   _CRTIMP                         As above.  For MS compatibility.
-   __MINGW32_VERSION               Runtime version.
-   __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION         Runtime major version.
-   __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION         Runtime minor version.
-   __MINGW32_BUILD_DATE            Runtime build date.
-
-   Macros to enable MinGW features which deviate from standard MSVC
-   compatible behaviour; these may be specified directly in user code,
-   activated implicitly, (e.g. by specifying _POSIX_C_SOURCE or such),
-   or by inclusion in __MINGW_FEATURES__:
-
-   __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO          Select a more ANSI C99 compatible
-                                   implementation of printf() and friends.
-
-   Other macros:
-
-   __int64                         define to be long long.  Using a typedef
-                                   doesn\'t work for "unsigned __int64"
-
-   All headers should include this first, and then use __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-   to choose between the old ``__imp__name\'\' style or __MINGW_IMPORT
-   style declarations.  */
-
-
-/* Manifest definitions identifying the flag bits, controlling activation
- * of MinGW features, as specified by the user in __MINGW_FEATURES__.
- */
-#define __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__\t\t0x0000000000000001ULL

- * The following three are not yet formally supported; they are

-/* #undef __attribute__ */ /* this undefines special QAC/QAC++ config */

-/* Attribute `nonnull\' was valid as of gcc 3.3.  We don\'t use GCC\'s

-   errors with  --traditional-cpp.  */

-
-#ifndef __MSVCRT_VERSION__
-/*  High byte is the major version, low byte is the minor. */
-# define __MSVCRT_VERSION__ 0x0600
-#endif

-/* Activation of MinGW specific extended features:
- */
-#ifndef __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO
-/*

- */
-# if   defined __STRICT_ANSI__  ||  defined _ISOC99_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _POSIX_SOURCE    ||  defined _POSIX_C_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _XOPEN_SOURCE    ||  defined _XOPEN_SOURCE_EXTENDED \\
-   ||  defined _GNU_SOURCE      ||  defined _BSD_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _SVID_SOURCE
-   /*
-    * but where any of these source code qualifiers are specified,
-    * then assume ANSI I/O standards are preferred over Microsoft\'s...
-    */
-#  define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO    1
-# else
-   /*
-    * otherwise use whatever __MINGW_FEATURES__ specifies...
-    */
-#  define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO    (__MINGW_FEATURES__ & __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__)
-# endif
-#endif

-#endif /* __MINGW_H */

-#ifndef _I386_ERRNO_H
-#define _I386_ERRNO_H
-
-#define\tEPERM\t\t 1\t/* Operation not permitted */
-#define\tENOENT\t\t 2\t/* No such file or directory */
-#define\tESRCH\t\t 3\t/* No such process */
-#define\tEINTR\t\t 4\t/* Interrupted system call */
-#define\tEIO\t\t 5\t/* I/O error */
-#define\tENXIO\t\t 6\t/* No such device or address */
-#define\tE2BIG\t\t 7\t/* Arg list too long */
-#define\tENOEXEC\t\t 8\t/* Exec format error */
-#define\tEBADF\t\t 9\t/* Bad file number */
-#define\tECHILD\t\t10\t/* No child processes */
-#define\tEAGAIN\t\t11\t/* Try again */
-#define\tENOMEM\t\t12\t/* Out of memory */
-#define\tEACCES\t\t13\t/* Permission denied */
-#define\tEFAULT\t\t14\t/* Bad address */
-#define\tENOTBLK\t\t15\t/* Block device required */
-#define\tEBUSY\t\t16\t/* Device or resource busy */
-#define\tEEXIST\t\t17\t/* File exists */
-#define\tEXDEV\t\t18\t/* Cross-device link */
-#define\tENODEV\t\t19\t/* No such device */
-#define\tENOTDIR\t\t20\t/* Not a directory */
-#define\tEISDIR\t\t21\t/* Is a directory */
-#define\tEINVAL\t\t22\t/* Invalid argument */
-#define\tENFILE\t\t23\t/* File table overflow */
-#define\tEMFILE\t\t24\t/* Too many open files */
-#define\tENOTTY\t\t25\t/* Not a typewriter */
-#define\tETXTBSY\t\t26\t/* Text file busy */
-#define\tEFBIG\t\t27\t/* File too large */
-#define\tENOSPC\t\t28\t/* No space left on device */
-#define\tESPIPE\t\t29\t/* Illegal seek */
-#define\tEROFS\t\t30\t/* Read-only file system */
-#define\tEMLINK\t\t31\t/* Too many links */
-#define\tEPIPE\t\t32\t/* Broken pipe */
-#define\tEDOM\t\t33\t/* Math argument out of domain of func */
-#define\tERANGE\t\t34\t/* Math result not representable */
-#define\tEDEADLK\t\t35\t/* Resource deadlock would occur */
-#define\tENAMETOOLONG\t36\t/* File name too long */
-#define\tENOLCK\t\t37\t/* No record locks available */
-#define\tENOSYS\t\t38\t/* Function not implemented */
-#define\tENOTEMPTY\t39\t/* Directory not empty */
-#define\tELOOP\t\t40\t/* Too many symbolic links encountered */
-#define\tEWOULDBLOCK\tEAGAIN\t/* Operation would block */
-#define\tENOMSG\t\t42\t/* No message of desired type */
-#define\tEIDRM\t\t43\t/* Identifier removed */
-#define\tECHRNG\t\t44\t/* Channel number out of range */
-#define\tEL2NSYNC\t45\t/* Level 2 not synchronized */
-#define\tEL3HLT\t\t46\t/* Level 3 halted */
-#define\tEL3RST\t\t47\t/* Level 3 reset */
-#define\tELNRNG\t\t48\t/* Link number out of range */
-#define\tEUNATCH\t\t49\t/* Protocol driver not attached */
-#define\tENOCSI\t\t50\t/* No CSI structure available */
-#define\tEL2HLT\t\t51\t/* Level 2 halted */
-#define\tEBADE\t\t52\t/* Invalid exchange */
-#define\tEBADR\t\t53\t/* Invalid request descriptor */
-#define\tEXFULL\t\t54\t/* Exchange full */
-#define\tENOANO\t\t55\t/* No anode */
-#define\tEBADRQC\t\t56\t/* Invalid request code */
-#define\tEBADSLT\t\t57\t/* Invalid slot */
-
-#define\tEDEADLOCK\tEDEADLK
-
-#define\tEBFONT\t\t59\t/* Bad font file format */
-#define\tENOSTR\t\t60\t/* Device not a stream */
-#define\tENODATA\t\t61\t/* No data available */
-#define\tETIME\t\t62\t/* Timer expired */
-#define\tENOSR\t\t63\t/* Out of streams resources */
-#define\tENONET\t\t64\t/* Machine is not on the network */
-#define\tENOPKG\t\t65\t/* Package not installed */
-#define\tEREMOTE\t\t66\t/* Object is remote */
-#define\tENOLINK\t\t67\t/* Link has been severed */
-#define\tEADV\t\t68\t/* Advertise error */
-#define\tESRMNT\t\t69\t/* Srmount error */
-#define\tECOMM\t\t70\t/* Communication error on send */
-#define\tEPROTO\t\t71\t/* Protocol error */
-#define\tEMULTIHOP\t72\t/* Multihop attempted */
-#define\tEDOTDOT\t\t73\t/* RFS specific error */
-#define\tEBADMSG\t\t74\t/* Not a data message */
-#define\tEOVERFLOW\t75\t/* Value too large for defined data type */
-#define\tENOTUNIQ\t76\t/* Name not unique on network */
-#define\tEBADFD\t\t77\t/* File descriptor in bad state */
-#define\tEREMCHG\t\t78\t/* Remote address changed */
-#define\tELIBACC\t\t79\t/* Can not access a needed shared library */
-#define\tELIBBAD\t\t80\t/* Accessing a corrupted shared library */
-#define\tELIBSCN\t\t81\t/* .lib section in a.out corrupted */
-#define\tELIBMAX\t\t82\t/* Attempting to link in too many shared libraries */
-#define\tELIBEXEC\t83\t/* Cannot exec a shared library directly */
-#define\tEILSEQ\t\t84\t/* Illegal byte sequence */
-#define\tERESTART\t85\t/* Interrupted system call should be restarted */
-#define\tESTRPIPE\t86\t/* Streams pipe error */
-#define\tEUSERS\t\t87\t/* Too many users */
-#define\tENOTSOCK\t88\t/* Socket operation on non-socket */
-#define\tEDESTADDRREQ\t89\t/* Destination address required */
-#define\tEMSGSIZE\t90\t/* Message too long */
-#define\tEPROTOTYPE\t91\t/* Protocol wrong type for socket */
-#define\tENOPROTOOPT\t92\t/* Protocol not available */
-#define\tEPROTONOSUPPORT\t93\t/* Protocol not supported */
-#define\tESOCKTNOSUPPORT\t94\t/* Socket type not supported */
-#define\tEOPNOTSUPP\t95\t/* Operation not supported on transport endpoint */
-#define\tEPFNOSUPPORT\t96\t/* Protocol family not supported */
-#define\tEAFNOSUPPORT\t97\t/* Address family not supported by protocol */
-#define\tEADDRINUSE\t98\t/* Address already in use */
-#define\tEADDRNOTAVAIL\t99\t/* Cannot assign requested address */
-#define\tENETDOWN\t100\t/* Network is down */
-#define\tENETUNREACH\t101\t/* Network is unreachable */
-#define\tENETRESET\t102\t/* Network dropped connection because of reset */
-#define\tECONNABORTED\t103\t/* Software caused connection abort */
-#define\tECONNRESET\t104\t/* Connection reset by peer */
-#define\tENOBUFS\t\t105\t/* No buffer space available */
-#define\tEISCONN\t\t106\t/* Transport endpoint is already connected */
-#define\tENOTCONN\t107\t/* Transport endpoint is not connected */
-#define\tESHUTDOWN\t108\t/* Cannot send after transport endpoint shutdown */
-#define\tETOOMANYREFS\t109\t/* Too many references: cannot splice */
-#define\tETIMEDOUT\t110\t/* Connection timed out */
-#define\tECONNREFUSED\t111\t/* Connection refused */
-#define\tEHOSTDOWN\t112\t/* Host is down */
-#define\tEHOSTUNREACH\t113\t/* No route to host */
-#define\tEALREADY\t114\t/* Operation already in progress */
-#define\tEINPROGRESS\t115\t/* Operation now in progress */
-#define\tESTALE\t\t116\t/* Stale NFS file handle */
-#define\tEUCLEAN\t\t117\t/* Structure needs cleaning */
-#define\tENOTNAM\t\t118\t/* Not a XENIX named type file */
-#define\tENAVAIL\t\t119\t/* No XENIX semaphores available */
-#define\tEISNAM\t\t120\t/* Is a named type file */
-#define\tEREMOTEIO\t121\t/* Remote I/O error */
-#define\tEDQUOT\t\t122\t/* Quota exceeded */
-
-#define\tENOMEDIUM\t123\t/* No medium found */
-#define\tEMEDIUMTYPE\t124\t/* Wrong medium type */

-#endif

-#ifndef GENERIC_FI_H
-#define GENERIC_FI_H
-
-/* Compilers may use another function within the assert macro to exit the 
- * program. QAC thus does not see an "exit" function and assumes the 
- * function returns, which it does not.
- * The below pragma tells QAC the compiler supplied function does not
- * return.
- */
-
-/* examples - GCC, ICC, BCC 3.1, BCC 5.5, CYGWIN gcc, Watcom 1.6 */
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_perror_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert
-
-/* Depending on the code that the compiler maker uses within the assert macro,
- * QAC may issue warnings. It is also possible that when the NDEBUG macro is used
- * to suppress the assertion code, QAC may issue a "no side-effects" warning.
- * To eliminate these, we turn off all warnings for the assert macro.
- */
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "assert"
-
-
-/* Any other items that may be required in a "force-include" file should
- * be placed below.
- */
-
-/* to avoid problems with GCC using builtin functions for va_start
- * and QAC issuing unset variable warnings.
- */
-typedef void * __builtin_va_list;
-#define __builtin_va_start(ap, parmN)\t((void)((ap)= &(parmN)))
-#define __builtin_va_arg(ap, type)\t(*(type*)(ap))
-#define __builtin_va_end(ap)\t\t((void)((ap)=0))
-#define __builtin_va_copy(d,s)
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "va_end"
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "__va_copy"
-
-#define  __builtin_offsetof(type, member) ((size_t) &((type *)0)->member)
-
-/* these defines are used here because GCC uses builtin functions to speed
- * the operation. The below are generic defines.
- */
-#ifndef FD_SET
-#define fds_bits __fds_bits
-#define FD_SETSIZE      (sizeof(fd_set) * 8)
-#define FD_SET(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] |= (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_CLR(n, p)    (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] &= ~(1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ISSET(n, p)  (((fd_set *) (p))->fds_bits[0] & (1 << ((n) % 32)))
-#define FD_ZERO(p)      memset((p), 0, sizeof(*(p)))
-#endif
-
-/* The contents below are actually from GCC limits header but were only
- * to be used if the header was to be used with a non-GCC compiler. If
- * __GNUC__ is defined, an "include_next" directive is used which QAC does not 
- * support as yet.
- */

-/* Number of bits in a \'char\'.\t*/
-#ifndef CHAR_BIT

-#define SCHAR_MAX\t127
-#endif

-#define UCHAR_MAX\t255
-#endif

-#ifdef __CHAR_UNSIGNED__
-#define CHAR_MIN\t0
-#define CHAR_MAX\tUCHAR_MAX
-#else
-#define CHAR_MIN\tSCHAR_MIN
-#define CHAR_MAX\tSCHAR_MAX
-#endif

-#define INT_MAX\t2147483647

-#endif

-#ifndef __MINGW_H
-/*
- * _mingw.h
- *
- * Mingw specific macros included by ALL include files.
- *
- * This file is part of the Mingw32 package.
- *
- * Contributors:
- *  Created by Mumit Khan  <khan@xraylith.wisc.edu>
- *
- *  THIS SOFTWARE IS NOT COPYRIGHTED
- *
- *  This source code is offered for use in the public domain. You may
- *  use, modify or distribute it freely.
- *
- *  This code is distributed in the hope that it will be useful but
- *  WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY. ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED ARE HEREBY
- *  DISCLAIMED. This includes but is not limited to warranties of
- *  MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
- *
- */
-#define __MINGW_H
-
-#define __MINGW32_VERSION           3.20
-#define __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION     3
-#define __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION     20
-#define __MINGW32_PATCHLEVEL        0
-
-#if __GNUC__ >= 3
-#ifndef __PCC__
-#pragma GCC system_header
-#endif
-#endif
-
-/* These are defined by the user (or the compiler)
-   to specify how identifiers are imported from a DLL.
-
-   __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED            Defined if dllimport attribute is supported.
-   __MINGW_IMPORT                  The attribute definition to specify imported
-                                   variables/functions.
-   _CRTIMP                         As above.  For MS compatibility.
-   __MINGW32_VERSION               Runtime version.
-   __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION         Runtime major version.
-   __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION         Runtime minor version.
-   __MINGW32_BUILD_DATE            Runtime build date.
-
-   Macros to enable MinGW features which deviate from standard MSVC
-   compatible behaviour; these may be specified directly in user code,
-   activated implicitly, (e.g. by specifying _POSIX_C_SOURCE or such),
-   or by inclusion in __MINGW_FEATURES__:
-
-   __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO          Select a more ANSI C99 compatible
-                                   implementation of printf() and friends.
-
-   Other macros:
-
-   __int64                         define to be long long.  Using a typedef
-                                   doesn\'t work for "unsigned __int64"
-
-   All headers should include this first, and then use __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-   to choose between the old ``__imp__name\'\' style or __MINGW_IMPORT
-   style declarations.  */
-
-
-/* Manifest definitions identifying the flag bits, controlling activation
- * of MinGW features, as specified by the user in __MINGW_FEATURES__.
- */
-#define __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__\t\t0x0000000000000001ULL
-/*
- * The following three are not yet formally supported; they are
- * included here, to document anticipated future usage.
- */
-#define __MINGW_LC_EXTENSIONS__ \t0x0000000000000050ULL
-#define __MINGW_LC_MESSAGES__\t\t0x0000000000000010ULL
-#define __MINGW_LC_ENVVARS__\t\t0x0000000000000040ULL
-
-/* Try to avoid problems with outdated checks for GCC __attribute__ support.  */
-/* #undef __attribute__ */ /* this undefines special QAC/QAC++ config */
-
-#if defined (__PCC__)
-#  undef __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  define __MINGW_IMPORT extern
-# endif
-# ifndef _CRTIMP
-#  define _CRTIMP
-# endif
-# ifndef __cdecl
-#  define __cdecl  _Pragma("cdecl")
-# endif
-# ifndef __stdcall
-#  define __stdcall _Pragma("stdcall")
-# endif
-# ifndef __int64
-#  define __int64 long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int32
-#  define __int32 long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int16
-#  define __int16 short
-# endif
-# ifndef __int8
-#  define __int8 char
-# endif
-# ifndef __small
-#  define __small char
-# endif
-# ifndef __hyper
-#  define __hyper long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __volatile__
-#  define __volatile__ volatile
-# endif
-# ifndef __restrict__
-#  define __restrict__ restrict
-# endif
-# define NONAMELESSUNION
-#elif defined(__GNUC__)
-# ifdef __declspec
-#  ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-   /* Note the extern. This is needed to work around GCC\'s
-      limitations in handling dllimport attribute.  */
-#   define __MINGW_IMPORT  extern __attribute__ ((__dllimport__))
-#  endif
-#  ifndef _CRTIMP
-#   ifdef __USE_CRTIMP
-#    define _CRTIMP  __attribute__ ((dllimport))
-#   else
-#    define _CRTIMP
-#   endif
-#  endif
-#  define __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# else /* __declspec */
-#  undef __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-#  undef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  ifndef _CRTIMP
-#   define _CRTIMP
-#  endif
-# endif /* __declspec */
-/*
- * The next two defines can cause problems if user code adds the
- * __cdecl attribute like so:
- * void __attribute__ ((__cdecl)) foo(void);
- */
-# ifndef __cdecl
-#  define __cdecl  __attribute__ ((__cdecl__))
-# endif
-# ifndef __stdcall
-#  define __stdcall __attribute__ ((__stdcall__))
-# endif
-# ifndef __int64
-#  define __int64 long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int32
-#  define __int32 long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int16
-#  define __int16 short
-# endif
-# ifndef __int8
-#  define __int8 char
-# endif
-# ifndef __small
-#  define __small char
-# endif
-# ifndef __hyper
-#  define __hyper long long
-# endif
-#else /* ! __GNUC__ && ! __PCC__ */
-# ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  define __MINGW_IMPORT  __declspec(dllimport)
-# endif
-# ifndef _CRTIMP
-#  define _CRTIMP  __declspec(dllimport)
-# endif
-# define __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# define __attribute__(x) /* nothing */
-#endif
-
-#if defined (__GNUC__) && defined (__GNUC_MINOR__)
-#define __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ(major, minor) \\
-  (__GNUC__ > (major) \\
-   || (__GNUC__ == (major) && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= (minor)))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ(major, minor)  0
-#endif
-
-#ifdef __cplusplus
-# define __CRT_INLINE inline
-#else
-# if __GNUC_STDC_INLINE__
-#  define __CRT_INLINE extern inline __attribute__((__gnu_inline__))
-# else
-#  define __CRT_INLINE extern __inline__
-# endif
-#endif
-
-# ifdef __GNUC__
-#  define _CRTALIAS __CRT_INLINE __attribute__ ((__always_inline__))
-# else
-#  define _CRTALIAS __CRT_INLINE
-# endif
-
-#ifdef __cplusplus
-# define __UNUSED_PARAM(x)
-#else
-# ifdef __GNUC__
-#  define __UNUSED_PARAM(x) x __attribute__ ((__unused__))
-# else
-#  define __UNUSED_PARAM(x) x
-# endif
-#endif
-
-#ifdef __GNUC__
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NORETURN __attribute__ ((__noreturn__))
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_CONST __attribute__ ((__const__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NORETURN
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_CONST
-#endif
-
-#if __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 0)
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_MALLOC __attribute__ ((__malloc__))
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_PURE __attribute__ ((__pure__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_MALLOC
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_PURE
-#endif
-
-/* Attribute `nonnull\' was valid as of gcc 3.3.  We don\'t use GCC\'s
-   variadiac macro facility, because variadic macros cause syntax
-   errors with  --traditional-cpp.  */
-#if  __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 3)
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NONNULL(arg) __attribute__ ((__nonnull__ (arg)))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NONNULL(arg)
-#endif /* GNUC >= 3.3 */
-
-#if  __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 1)
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_DEPRECATED __attribute__ ((__deprecated__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_DEPRECATED
-#endif /* GNUC >= 3.1 */
-
-#if  __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 3)
-#define __MINGW_NOTHROW __attribute__ ((__nothrow__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_NOTHROW
-#endif /* GNUC >= 3.3 */
-
-
-/* TODO: Mark (almost) all CRT functions as __MINGW_NOTHROW.  This will
-allow GCC to optimize away some EH unwind code, at least in DW2 case.  */
-
-#ifndef __MSVCRT_VERSION__
-/*  High byte is the major version, low byte is the minor. */
-# define __MSVCRT_VERSION__ 0x0600
-#endif
-
-/* Activation of MinGW specific extended features:
- */
-#ifndef __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO
-/*
- * If user didn\'t specify it explicitly...
- */
-# if   defined __STRICT_ANSI__  ||  defined _ISOC99_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _POSIX_SOURCE    ||  defined _POSIX_C_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _XOPEN_SOURCE    ||  defined _XOPEN_SOURCE_EXTENDED \\
-   ||  defined _GNU_SOURCE      ||  defined _BSD_SOURCE \\
-   ||  defined _SVID_SOURCE
-   /*
-    * but where any of these source code qualifiers are specified,
-    * then assume ANSI I/O standards are preferred over Microsoft\'s...
-    */
-#  define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO    1
-# else
-   /*
-    * otherwise use whatever __MINGW_FEATURES__ specifies...
-    */
-#  define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO    (__MINGW_FEATURES__ & __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__)
-# endif
-#endif
-
-#endif /* __MINGW_H */

-#ifndef GENERIC_FI_H
-#define GENERIC_FI_H
-
-/* Compilers may use another function within the assert macro to exit the
- * program. QAC thus does not see an "exit" function and assumes the
- * function returns, which it does not.
- * The below pragma tells QAC the compiler supplied function does not
- * return.
- */
-
-/* examples - GCC, ICC, BCC 3.1, BCC 5.5, CYGWIN gcc, Watcom 1.6 */
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_perror_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert
-
-/* Depending on the code that the compiler maker uses within the assert macro,
- * QAC may issue warnings. It is also possible that when the NDEBUG macro is used
- * to suppress the assertion code, QAC may issue a "no side-effects" warning.
- * To eliminate these, we turn off all warnings for the assert macro.
- */
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "assert"
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "errno"
-
-
-/* Any other items that may be required in a "force-include" file should
- * be placed below.

-#ifndef __MINGW_H
-/*
- * _mingw.h
- *
- * Mingw specific macros included by ALL include files.
- *
- * This file is part of the Mingw32 package.
- *
- * Contributors:
- *  Created by Mumit Khan  <khan@xraylith.wisc.edu>
- *
- *  THIS SOFTWARE IS NOT COPYRIGHTED
- *
- *  This source code is offered for use in the public domain. You may
- *  use, modify or distribute it freely.
- *
- *  This code is distributed in the hope that it will be useful but
- *  WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY. ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED ARE HEREBY
- *  DISCLAIMED. This includes but is not limited to warranties of
- *  MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
- *
- */
-#define __MINGW_H
-
-#define __MINGW32_VERSION           3.20
-#define __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION     3
-#define __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION     20
-#define __MINGW32_PATCHLEVEL        0
-
-#if __GNUC__ >= 3
-#ifndef __PCC__
-#pragma GCC system_header
-#endif
-#endif
-
-/* These are defined by the user (or the compiler)
-   to specify how identifiers are imported from a DLL.
-
-   __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED            Defined if dllimport attribute is supported.
-   __MINGW_IMPORT                  The attribute definition to specify imported
-                                   variables/functions.
-   _CRTIMP                         As above.  For MS compatibility.
-   __MINGW32_VERSION               Runtime version.
-   __MINGW32_MAJOR_VERSION         Runtime major version.
-   __MINGW32_MINOR_VERSION         Runtime minor version.
-   __MINGW32_BUILD_DATE            Runtime build date.
-
-   Macros to enable MinGW features which deviate from standard MSVC
-   compatible behaviour; these may be specified directly in user code,
-   activated implicitly, (e.g. by specifying _POSIX_C_SOURCE or such),
-   or by inclusion in __MINGW_FEATURES__:
-
-   __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO          Select a more ANSI C99 compatible
-                                   implementation of printf() and friends.
-
-   Other macros:
-
-   __int64                         define to be long long.  Using a typedef
-                                   doesn\'t work for "unsigned __int64"
-
-   All headers should include this first, and then use __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-   to choose between the old ``__imp__name\'\' style or __MINGW_IMPORT
-   style declarations.  */
-
-
-/* Manifest definitions identifying the flag bits, controlling activation
- * of MinGW features, as specified by the user in __MINGW_FEATURES__.
- */
-#define __MINGW_ANSI_STDIO__\t\t0x0000000000000001ULL
-/*
- * The following three are not yet formally supported; they are
- * included here, to document anticipated future usage.
- */
-#define __MINGW_LC_EXTENSIONS__ \t0x0000000000000050ULL
-#define __MINGW_LC_MESSAGES__\t\t0x0000000000000010ULL
-#define __MINGW_LC_ENVVARS__\t\t0x0000000000000040ULL
-
-/* Try to avoid problems with outdated checks for GCC __attribute__ support.  */
-/* #undef __attribute__ */ /* this undefines special QAC/QAC++ config */
-
-#if defined (__PCC__)
-#  undef __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  define __MINGW_IMPORT extern
-# endif
-# ifndef _CRTIMP
-#  define _CRTIMP
-# endif
-# ifndef __cdecl
-#  define __cdecl  _Pragma("cdecl")
-# endif
-# ifndef __stdcall
-#  define __stdcall _Pragma("stdcall")
-# endif
-# ifndef __int64
-#  define __int64 long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int32
-#  define __int32 long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int16
-#  define __int16 short
-# endif
-# ifndef __int8
-#  define __int8 char
-# endif
-# ifndef __small
-#  define __small char
-# endif
-# ifndef __hyper
-#  define __hyper long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __volatile__
-#  define __volatile__ volatile
-# endif
-# ifndef __restrict__
-#  define __restrict__ restrict
-# endif
-# define NONAMELESSUNION
-#elif defined(__GNUC__)
-# ifdef __declspec
-#  ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-   /* Note the extern. This is needed to work around GCC\'s
-      limitations in handling dllimport attribute.  */
-#   define __MINGW_IMPORT  extern __attribute__ ((__dllimport__))
-#  endif
-#  ifndef _CRTIMP
-#   ifdef __USE_CRTIMP
-#    define _CRTIMP  __attribute__ ((dllimport))
-#   else
-#    define _CRTIMP
-#   endif
-#  endif
-#  define __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# else /* __declspec */
-#  undef __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-#  undef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  ifndef _CRTIMP
-#   define _CRTIMP
-#  endif
-# endif /* __declspec */
-/*
- * The next two defines can cause problems if user code adds the
- * __cdecl attribute like so:
- * void __attribute__ ((__cdecl)) foo(void);
- */
-# ifndef __cdecl
-#  define __cdecl  __attribute__ ((__cdecl__))
-# endif
-# ifndef __stdcall
-#  define __stdcall __attribute__ ((__stdcall__))
-# endif
-# ifndef __int64
-#  define __int64 long long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int32
-#  define __int32 long
-# endif
-# ifndef __int16
-#  define __int16 short
-# endif
-# ifndef __int8
-#  define __int8 char
-# endif
-# ifndef __small
-#  define __small char
-# endif
-# ifndef __hyper
-#  define __hyper long long
-# endif
-#else /* ! __GNUC__ && ! __PCC__ */
-# ifndef __MINGW_IMPORT
-#  define __MINGW_IMPORT  __declspec(dllimport)
-# endif
-# ifndef _CRTIMP
-#  define _CRTIMP  __declspec(dllimport)
-# endif
-# define __DECLSPEC_SUPPORTED
-# define __attribute__(x) /* nothing */
-#endif
-
-#if defined (__GNUC__) && defined (__GNUC_MINOR__)

-  (__GNUC__ > (major) \\
-   || (__GNUC__ == (major) && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= (minor)))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ(major, minor)  0
-#endif
-
-#ifdef __cplusplus
-# define __CRT_INLINE inline
-#else
-# if __GNUC_STDC_INLINE__

-# else
-#  define __CRT_INLINE extern __inline__
-# endif
-#endif
-
-# ifdef __GNUC__
-#  define _CRTALIAS __CRT_INLINE __attribute__ ((__always_inline__))
-# else
-#  define _CRTALIAS __CRT_INLINE
-# endif

-#else

-# else

-#endif
-

-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_CONST __attribute__ ((__const__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NORETURN

-#endif
-
-#if __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 0)

-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_PURE __attribute__ ((__pure__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_MALLOC
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_PURE
-#endif
-
-/* Attribute `nonnull\' was valid as of gcc 3.3.  We don\'t use GCC\'s
-   variadiac macro facility, because variadic macros cause syntax
-   errors with  --traditional-cpp.  */
-#if  __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 3)

-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_NONNULL(arg)
-#endif /* GNUC >= 3.3 */
-
-#if  __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 1)
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_DEPRECATED __attribute__ ((__deprecated__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_ATTRIB_DEPRECATED
-#endif /* GNUC >= 3.1 */
-
-#if  __MINGW_GNUC_PREREQ (3, 3)
-#define __MINGW_NOTHROW __attribute__ ((__nothrow__))
-#else
-#define __MINGW_NOTHROW
-#endif /* GNUC >= 3.3 */

-/* TODO: Mark (almost) all CRT functions as __MINGW_NOTHROW.  This will
-allow GCC to optimize away some EH unwind code, at least in DW2 case.  */
-
-#ifndef __MSVCRT_VERSION__
-/*  High byte is the major version, low byte is the minor. */
-# define __MSVCRT_VERSION__ 0x0600
-#endif
-

-#ifndef GENERIC_FI_H

-
-/* Compilers may use another function within the assert macro to exit the
- * program. QAC thus does not see an "exit" function and assumes the
- * function returns, which it does not.
- * The below pragma tells QAC the compiler supplied function does not
- * return.
- */
-
-/* examples - GCC, ICC, BCC 3.1, BCC 5.5, CYGWIN gcc, Watcom 1.6 */
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert_perror_fail
-#pragma PRQA_NO_RETURN __assert
-
-/* Depending on the code that the compiler maker uses within the assert macro,
- * QAC may issue warnings. It is also possible that when the NDEBUG macro is used
- * to suppress the assertion code, QAC may issue a "no side-effects" warning.
- * To eliminate these, we turn off all warnings for the assert macro.
- */
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "assert"
-#pragma PRQA_MACRO_MESSAGES_OFF "errno"

-        # first argument must be the product

");

");
